verses.textEn: And it happened afterwards that Alexander, the son of Philip the Macedonian, who first reigned in Greece having come from the land of Kittim, struck Darius the king of the Persians and the Medes.
verses.textLa: Et factum est postquam percussit Alexander Philippi Macedo, qui primus regnavit in Græcia, egressus de terra Cethim, Darium regem Persarum, et Medorum:
verses.notes: Notice that the book begins as if it were a continuation of another book: “And it happened afterwards....” The author of this book must have written another book (apparently one not inspired as Scripture), on the topic of Jewish history. That book is not part of Scripture and this one is.

verses.textEn: He appointed many battles, and he took hold of all the fortifications, and he executed the kings of the earth.
verses.textLa: constituit prælia multa, et obtinuit omnium munitiones, et interfecit reges terræ,

verses.textEn: And he passed through even to the ends of the earth. And he received the spoils of many nations. And the earth was silenced in his sight.
verses.textLa: et pertransiit usque ad fines terræ: et accepit spolia multitudinis gentium: et siluit terra in conspectu eius.

verses.textEn: And he gathered together power, and an exceedingly strong army. And he was exalted, and his heart was lifted up.
verses.textLa: Et congregavit virtutem, et exercitum fortem nimis: et exaltatum est, et elevatum cor eius:

verses.textEn: And he captured the regions of nations and of sovereign leaders, and they became tributaries to him.
verses.textLa: et obtinuit regiones Gentium, et tyrannos: et facti sunt illi in tributum.

verses.textEn: And after these things, he fell down on his bed, and he knew that he would die.
verses.textLa: Et post hæc decidit in lectum, et cognovit quia moreretur.

verses.textEn: And he called his servants, nobles who were raised with him from his youth. And he divided his kingdom to them, while he was still alive.
verses.textLa: Et vocavit pueros suos nobiles, qui secum erant nutriti a iuventute: et divisit illis regnum suum, cum adhuc viveret.

verses.textEn: And Alexander reigned twelve years, and then he died.
verses.textLa: Et regnavit Alexander annis duodecim, et mortuus est.

verses.textEn: And his servants obtained his kingdom, each one in his place.
verses.textLa: Et obtinuerunt pueri eius regnum, unusquisque in loco suo:

verses.textEn: And they all put diadems on themselves after his death, and their sons after them, for many years; and evils were multiplied on the earth.
verses.textLa: et imposuerunt omnes sibi diademata post mortem eius, et filii eorum post eos annis multis, et multiplicata sunt mala in terra.

verses.textEn: And there went forth from among them a sinful root, Antiochus the illustrious, the son of king Antiochus, who had been a hostage at Rome. And he reigned in the one hundred and thirty-seventh year of the kingdom of the Greeks.
verses.textLa: Et exiit ex eis radix peccatrix, Antiochus illustris, filius Antiochi regis, qui fuerat Romæ obses: et regnavit in anno centesimo trigesimo septimo regni Græcorum.

verses.textEn: In those days, there went forth from Israel sons of iniquity, and they persuaded many, saying: “Let us go and negotiate a covenant with the Gentiles that are all around us. For since we have withdrawn from them, many evils have found us.”
verses.textLa: In diebus illis, exierunt ex Israel filii iniqui, et suaserunt multis, dicentes: Eamus, et disponamus testamentum cum Gentibus, quæ circa nos sunt: quia ex quo recessimus ab eis, invenerunt nos multa mala.

verses.textEn: And the word seemed good in their eyes.
verses.textLa: Et bonus visus est sermo in oculis eorum.

verses.textEn: And some of the people determined to do this, and they went to the king. And he gave them the power to act according to the justice of the Gentiles.
verses.textLa: Et destinaverunt aliqui de populo, et abierunt ad regem: et dedit illis potestatem ut facerent iustitiam Gentium.

verses.textEn: And they built a sports arena in Jerusalem, according to the laws of the Nations.
verses.textLa: Et ædificaverunt gymnasium in Ierosolymis secundum leges Nationum:

verses.textEn: And they made themselves uncircumcised, and they withdrew from the holy covenant, and they were joined to the nations, and they were sold into evil-doing.
verses.textLa: et fecerunt sibi præputia, et recesserunt a testamento sancto, et iuncti sunt Nationibus, et venundati sunt ut facerent malum.
verses.notes: Literally, they made themselves foreskins, in other words, they tried to undo their circumcision. This verse has a spiritual meaning, referring to those Christians who abandon the faith and act as if they were never baptized.

verses.textEn: And the kingdom was ready in the sight of Antiochus, and he began to reign over the land of Egypt, so that he might reign over two kingdoms.
verses.textLa: Et paratum est regnum in conspectu Antiochi, et cœpit regnare in terra Ægypti ut regnaret super duo regna.

verses.textEn: And he entered into Egypt with an oppressive multitude, with swift chariots, and elephants, and horsemen, and a great abundance of ships.
verses.textLa: Et intravit in Ægyptum in multitudine gravi, in curribus, et elephantis, et equitibus, et copiosa navium multitudine:

verses.textEn: And he appointed a war against Ptolemy, the king of Egypt, and Ptolemy was filled with dread before his face, and he fled, and many fell down wounded.
verses.textLa: et constituit bellum adversus Ptolemæum regem Ægypti, et veritus est Ptolemæus a facie eius, et fugit, et ceciderunt vulnerati multi.

verses.textEn: And he took hold of the fortified cities in the land of Egypt, and he received the spoils of the land of Egypt.
verses.textLa: Et comprehendit civitates munitas in terra Ægypti: et accepit spolia terræ Ægypti.

verses.textEn: And Antiochus turned back, after he struck Egypt, in the one hundred and forty-third year, and he ascended against Israel.
verses.textLa: Et convertit Antiochus, postquam percussit Ægyptum in centesimo et quadragesimo tertio anno: et ascendit ad Israel,

verses.textEn: And he ascended to Jerusalem, with an oppressive multitude.
verses.textLa: et ascendit Ierosolymam in multitudine gravi.

verses.textEn: And he entered into the sanctuary with arrogance, and he took the golden altar, and the lampstand of light, and all the vessels, and the table for the bread of the Presence, and the vessels of libation, and the vials, and the little mortars of gold, and the veil, and the crowns, and the golden ornament, which was at the face of the temple. And he crushed them all.
verses.textLa: Et intravit in sanctificationem cum superbia, et accepit altare aureum, et candelabrum luminis, et universa vasa eius, et mensam propositionis, et libatoria, et phialas, et mortariola aurea, et velum, et coronas, et ornamentum aureum, quod in facie templi erat: et comminuit omnia.
verses.notes: Literally, ‘mensam propositionis’ is ‘the table of showing,’ i.e. the table for the bread of the Presence used in ancient times by the Jews. This bread of the Presence was a foreshadowing of the Eucharist, in which Christ is fully Present. Antiochus was a foreshadowing of the Antichrist, who will take away the Eucharist from most places on earth, and replace it with the abomination of desolation.

verses.textEn: And he took the silver and gold, and the precious vessels, and he took the hidden treasures, which he found. And having taken all these things away, he departed into his own land.
verses.textLa: Et accepit argentum, et aurum, et vasa concupiscibilia: et accepit thesauros occultos, quos invenit: et sublatis omnibus abiit in terram suam.

verses.textEn: And he caused a massacre of men, and he was speaking with great arrogance.
verses.textLa: Et fecit cædem hominum, et locutus est in superbia magna.

verses.textEn: And there was great wailing in Israel and in all of their places.
verses.textLa: Et factus est planctus magnus in Israel, et in omni loco eorum:

verses.textEn: And the leaders and elders mourned, and the virgins and young men became weak, and the splendor of the women was changed.
verses.textLa: et ingemuerunt principes, et seniores: virgines, et iuvenes infirmati sunt: et speciositas mulierum immutata est.

verses.textEn: Every bridegroom took up lamentation, and those who sat in the marriage bed mourned.
verses.textLa: Omnis maritus sumpsit lamentum: et quæ sedebant in thoro maritali, lugebant:
verses.notes: A bridegroom is either one who is about to marry or one who has recently married. The expression, ‘those who sat in the marriage bed’ refers to newlyweds.

verses.textEn: And the land shook on behalf of the inhabitants in it, and the entire house of Jacob was clothed with confusion.
verses.textLa: et commota est terra super habitantes in ea, et universa domus Iacob induit confusionem.
verses.notes: The land shook because of an earthquake; this verse predicts an earthquake about the time that the Antichrist invades and conquers the holy land of Israel (about 2430/2431).

verses.textEn: And after two years of days, the king sent the prince of his tributes to the cities of Judah, and he came to Jerusalem with a great crowd.
verses.textLa: Et post duos annos dierum misit rex principem tributorum in civitates Iuda, et venit Ierusalem cum turba magna.
verses.notes: The expression ‘two years of days’ means two full years, as opposed to the usual Jewish method of counting the years, which would count any length of time overlapping two calendar years as two years.

verses.textEn: And he spoke peaceful words to them, in deceitfulness; and they believed him.
verses.textLa: Et locutus est ad eos verba pacifica in dolo: et crediderunt ei.

verses.textEn: And he rushed upon the city suddenly, and he struck it with a great scourging, and he destroyed many of the people of Israel.
verses.textLa: Et irruit super civitatem repente, et percussit eam plaga magna, et perdidit populum multum ex Israel.

verses.textEn: And he took the spoils of the city, and he burned it with fire, and he destroyed its houses and the walls around it.
verses.textLa: Et accepit spolia civitatis: et succendit eam igni, et destruxit domos eius, et muros eius in circuitu:

verses.textEn: And they led away the women as captives, and they possessed the children and the cattle.
verses.textLa: et captivas duxerunt mulieres: et natos, et pecora possederunt.

verses.textEn: And they built up the city of David with a great and strong wall, and with strong towers, and it became a stronghold for them.
verses.textLa: Et ædificaverunt civitatem David muro magno, et firmo, et turribus firmis, et facta est illis in arcem:

verses.textEn: And they set up in that place a sinful people, wicked men, and together they grew strong in it. And they stored up weapons and provisions. And they gathered together the spoils of Jerusalem,
verses.textLa: et posuerunt illic gentem peccatricem viros iniquos, et convaluerunt in ea. Et posuerunt arma, et escas, et congregaverunt spolia Ierusalem:

verses.textEn: and deposited them in that place. And they became a great snare.
verses.textLa: et reposuerunt illic: et facti sunt in laqueum magnum.

verses.textEn: And this became a place of ambush against the sanctuary and a diabolical evil in Israel.
verses.textLa: Et factum est hoc ad insidias sanctificationi, et in diabolum malum in Israel:

verses.textEn: And they poured out innocent blood around the sanctuary, and they contaminated the sanctuary.
verses.textLa: et effuderunt sanguinem innocentem per circuitum sanctificationis, et contaminaverunt sanctificationem.

verses.textEn: And the inhabitants of Jerusalem fled because of them, and the city became the dwelling place of outsiders, and she became a stranger to her own offspring, and her own children abandoned her.
verses.textLa: Et fugerunt habitatores Ierusalem propter eos, et facta est habitatio exterorum, et facta est extera semini suo, et nati eius reliquerunt eam.

verses.textEn: Her sanctuary was desolate, like a place of solitude, her feast days were turned into mourning, her Sabbaths into disgrace, her honors into nothing.
verses.textLa: Sanctificatio eius desolata est sicut solitudo, dies festi eius conversi sunt in luctum, Sabbata eius in opprobrium, honores eius in nihilum.

verses.textEn: Her shame was multiplied according to her glory, and her loftiness was turned into lamentation.
verses.textLa: Secundum gloriam eius multiplicata est ignominia eius: et sublimitas eius conversa est in luctum.

verses.textEn: And king Antiochus wrote to all his kingdom, that all the people must be one, and that each one should relinquish his own law.
verses.textLa: Et scripsit rex Antiochus omni regno suo ut esset omnis populus, unus: et relinqueret unusquisque legem suam.
verses.notes: Again, this is a foreshadowing of the Antichrist, who will try to unite all nations under his one government. All the unbelievers will comply, but the true believers in God will resist him.

verses.textEn: And all Gentiles consented, according to the word of king Antiochus.
verses.textLa: Et consenserunt omnes Gentes secundum verbum regis Antiochi:

verses.textEn: And many out of Israel consented to his servitude, and they sacrificed to idols, and they polluted the Sabbath.
verses.textLa: et multi ex Israel consenserunt servituti eius, et sacrificaverunt idolis, et coinquinaverunt Sabbatum.

verses.textEn: And the king sent letters, by the hand of messengers, to Jerusalem and to all the cities of Judah: that they should follow the law of the Nations of the earth,
verses.textLa: Et misit rex libros per manus nunciorum in Ierusalem, et in omnes civitates Iuda: ut sequerentur leges Gentium terræ,

verses.textEn: and that they should prohibit holocausts and sacrifices and atonements to be made in the temple of God,
verses.textLa: et prohiberent holocausta, et sacrificia, et placationes fieri in templo Dei,
verses.notes: This prohibition against religion was a foreshadowing of the Antichrist’s reign.

verses.textEn: and that they should prohibit the celebration of the Sabbath and the solemn days.
verses.textLa: et prohiberent celebrari Sabbatum, et dies sollemnes:

verses.textEn: And he ordered the holy places to be defiled, along with the holy people of Israel.
verses.textLa: et iussit coinquinari sancta, et sanctum populum Israel.

verses.textEn: And he ordered altars to be built, and temples, and idols, and he ordered the immolation of the flesh of swine and of unclean cattle,
verses.textLa: Et iussit ædificari aras, et templa, et idola, et immolari carnes suillas, et pecora communia,
verses.notes: This text refers, eschatologically, to the time during the Antichrist’s reign, when he tries to destroy the Church from within by promoting a perverse imitation of the sacrifice of the Mass and of the Eucharist. This perverse imitation of the Eucharist is called the abomination of desolation.

verses.textEn: and that they should leave their sons uncircumcised, and defile their souls with all that is unclean, and with abominations, so that they would forget the law and would alter all the justifications of God,
verses.textLa: et relinquere filios suos incircumcisos, et coinquinari animas eorum in omnibus immundis, et abominationibus, ita ut obliviscerentur legem, et immutarent omnes iustificationes Dei.
verses.notes:
Here is a clear example where ‘filios’ can only refer to male children, i.e. ‘sons.’ The word clearly means ‘sons,’ yet many translators insist on translating it inaccurately as ‘children.’ Inclusive language pleases society and displeases God.
 The abomination of desolation is mentioned here, in its foreshadowing during Old Testament times. Also mentioned is the badly altered version of the Christian faith that the Antichrist supports (beginning about halfway through his reign) in order to try to destroy the Church from within.

verses.textEn: and that whoever would not act according to the word of king Antiochus should be put to death.
verses.textLa: Et quicumque non fecissent secundum verbum regis Antiochi, morerentur.

verses.textEn: According to all these words, he wrote to all his kingdom. And he appointed leaders over the people, who would compel them to do these things.
verses.textLa: Secundum omnia verba hæc scripsit omni regno suo: et præposuit principes populo, qui hæc fieri cogerent.
verses.notes: These leaders foreshadow the apostate and severely heretical Christians who will be appointed by the Antichrist to try to destroy the Church from within. It is these ones who devise and set up the abomination of desolation, the perverse imitation of the Eucharist with its false and perverse imitation of the Mass.

verses.textEn: And these ordered the cities of Judah to sacrifice.
verses.textLa: Et iusserunt civitatibus Iuda sacrificare.

verses.textEn: And many from the people, who had abandoned the law of the Lord, were gathered together by them. And they committed evils upon the land.
verses.textLa: Et congregati sunt multi de populo ad eos, qui dereliquerant legem Domini: et fecerunt mala super terram:

verses.textEn: And they drove the people of Israel into hiding and into the secret places of fugitives.
verses.textLa: et effugaverunt populum Israel in abditis, et in absconditis fugitivorum locis.

verses.textEn: On the fifteenth day of the month of Kislev, in the one hundred and forty-fifth year, king Antiochus set up the abominable idol of desolation on the altar of God, and they built altars throughout all the surrounding cities of Judah.
verses.textLa: Die quintadecima mensis Casleu, quinto et quadragesimo et centesimo anno ædificavit rex Antiochus abominandum idolum desolationis super altare Dei, et per universas civitates Iuda in circuitu ædificaverunt aras:

verses.textEn: And they burned frankincense, and they sacrificed before the doors of houses and in the streets.
verses.textLa: et ante ianuas domorum et in plateis incendebant thura, et sacrificabant:

verses.textEn: And they cut up the books of the law of God and destroyed them with fire.
verses.textLa: et libros legis Dei combusserunt igni, scindentes eos:

verses.textEn: And all those who were found with the books of the testament of the Lord, and whoever observed the law of the Lord, they butchered, according to the edict of the king.
verses.textLa: et apud quemcumque inveniebantur libri testamenti Domini, et quicumque observabat legem Domini, secundum edictum regis trucidabant eum.
verses.notes: The word ‘trucidabant’ refers to killing someone, or a group of people, in a particularly violent manner, i.e. to butcher or to slaughter.

verses.textEn: By their power, they did these things to the people of Israel, as they were discovered in the cities, month after month.
verses.textLa: In virtute sua faciebant hæc populo Israel, qui inveniebatur in omni mense et mense in civitatibus.

verses.textEn: And on the twenty-fifth day of the month, they sacrificed on that altar which was opposite the high altar.
verses.textLa: Et quinta et vigesima die mensis sacrificabant super aram, quæ erat contra altare.

verses.textEn: And the women who circumcised their sons were butchered, according to the order of king Antiochus.
verses.textLa: Et mulieres, quæ circumcidebant filios suos, trucidabantur secundum iussum regis Antiochi,

verses.textEn: And they suspended the children by their necks in all their houses, and those who had circumcised them, they butchered.
verses.textLa: et suspendebant pueros a cervicibus per universas domos eorum: et eos, qui circumciderant illos, trucidabant.

verses.textEn: And many of the people of Israel decided within themselves that they would not eat unclean things. And they chose to die, rather than to be defiled with unclean foods.
verses.textLa: Et multi de populo Israel definierunt apud se, ut non manducarent immunda: et elegerunt magis mori, quam cibis coinquinari immundis:
verses.notes: Some Christians will choose to die, rather than to consume the abomination of desolation, that false and perverse imitation of the Eucharist.

verses.textEn: And they were not willing to infringe upon the holy law of God, and they were butchered.
verses.textLa: et noluerunt infringere legem Dei sanctam, et trucidati sunt:

verses.textEn: And there was a very great wrath upon the people.
verses.textLa: et facta est ira magna super populum valde.

verses.textEn: In those days, there rose up Mattathias, the son of John, the son of Simeon, a priest of the sons of Joarib from Jerusalem, and he settled on the mountain of Modin.
verses.textLa: In diebus illis surrexit Mathathias filius Ioannis, filii Simeonis, sacerdos ex filiis Ioarib ab Ierusalem, et consedit in monte Modin:

verses.textEn: And he had five sons: John, who was surnamed Gaddi,
verses.textLa: et habebat filios quinque, Ioannem, qui cognominabatur Gaddis:

verses.textEn: and Simon, who was surnamed Thassi,
verses.textLa: et Simonem, qui cognominabatur Thasi:

verses.textEn: and Judas, who was called Maccabeus,
verses.textLa: et Iudam, qui vocabatur Machabæus:

verses.textEn: and Eleazar, who was surnamed Avaran, and Jonathan, who was surnamed Apphus.
verses.textLa: et Eleazarum, qui cognominabatur Abaron: et Ionathan, qui cognominabatur Apphus.

verses.textEn: These saw the evils that were done among the people of Judah and in Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Hi viderunt mala, quæ fiebant in populo Iuda, et in Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And Mattathias said: “Woe to me, for why was I born to see the grief of my people and the grief of the holy city, and to sit there, while it is given into the hands of the enemies?
verses.textLa: Et dixit Mathathias: Væ mihi, ut quid natus sum videre contritionem populi mei, et contritionem civitatis sanctæ, et sedere illic, cum datur in manibus inimicorum?

verses.textEn: The holy places have fallen into the hands of outsiders. Her temple is like a man without honor.
verses.textLa: Sancta in manu extraneorum facta sunt: templum eius sicut homo ignobilis.

verses.textEn: The vessels of her glory have been taken away captive. Her old men have been butchered in the streets, and her young men have fallen by the sword of the enemies.
verses.textLa: Vasa gloriæ eius captiva abducta sunt: trucidati sunt senes eius in plateis, et iuvenes eius ceciderunt in gladio inimicorum.

verses.textEn: What nation has not inherited her kingdom and taken from her spoils?
verses.textLa: Quæ gens non hereditavit regnum eius, et non obtinuit spolia eius?

verses.textEn: All her beauty has been taken away. She who was free, has become a slave.
verses.textLa: Omnis compositio eius ablata est. Quæ erat libera, facta est ancilla.
verses.notes: The word ‘compositio’ can refer to medicine, or musical compositions, or ornaments. In the eschatological interpretation of this verse, it probably refers to things related to the Sacraments, which will be taken away by the Antichrist.

verses.textEn: And behold, our sanctuary, and our beauty, and our splendor has been desolated, and the Gentiles have defiled them.
verses.textLa: Et ecce sancta nostra, et pulchritudo nostra, et claritas nostra desolata est, et coinquinaverunt ea Gentes.

verses.textEn: Therefore, what is it to us that we still live?”
verses.textLa: Quo ergo nobis adhuc vivere?

verses.textEn: And Mattathias and his sons tore their garments, and they covered themselves with haircloth, and they lamented greatly.
verses.textLa: Et scidit vestimenta sua Mathathias, et filii eius: et operuerunt se ciliciis, et planxerunt valde.

verses.textEn: And those who had been sent from king Antiochus came to that place, to compel those who fled into the city of Modin to immolate, and to burn frankincense, and to depart from the law of God.
verses.textLa: Et venerunt illuc qui missi erant a rege Antiocho, ut cogerent eos, qui confugerant in civitatem Modin, immolare, et accendere thura, et a lege Dei discedere.

verses.textEn: And many of the people of Israel consented and came to them. But Mattathias and his sons stood firm.
verses.textLa: Et multi de populo Israel consentientes accesserunt ad eos: sed Mathathias, et filii eius constanter steterunt.

verses.textEn: And those who had been sent from Antiochus, responding, said to Mattathias: “You are a ruler, and very splendid and great in this city, and you are adorned with sons and brothers.
verses.textLa: Et respondentes qui missi erant ab Antiocho, dixerunt Mathathiæ: Princeps et clarissimus, et magnus es in hac civitate, et ornatus filiis, et fratribus.

verses.textEn: Therefore, approach first, and carryout the order of the king, as all the nations have done, and the men of Judah, and those who remained in Jerusalem. And you and your sons will be among the friends of the king, and enriched with gold and silver and many gifts.”
verses.textLa: Ergo accede prior, et fac iussum regis, sicut fecerunt omnes gentes, et viri Iuda, et qui remanserunt in Ierusalem: et eris tu, et filii tui inter amicos regis, et amplificatus auro, et argento, et muneribus multis.

verses.textEn: And Mattathias responded, and he said with a loud voice: “Even if all nations obey king Antiochus, so that each one departs from the service of the law of his fathers and consents to his commandments,
verses.textLa: Et respondit Mathathias, et dixit magna voce: Et si omnes gentes regi Antiocho obediunt, ut discedat unusquisque a servitute legis patrum suorum, et consentiat mandatis eius:

verses.textEn: I and my sons and my brothers will obey the law of our fathers.
verses.textLa: ego et filii mei, et fratres mei obediemus legi patrum nostrorum.

verses.textEn: May God be forgiving to us. It is not useful for us to abandon the law and the justices of God.
verses.textLa: Propitius sit nobis Deus: non est nobis utile relinquere legem, et iustitias Dei:

verses.textEn: We will not listen to the words of king Antiochus, nor will we sacrifice, transgressing the commandments of our law, so as to set out on another way.”
verses.textLa: non audiemus verba regis Antiochi, nec sacrificabimus transgredientes legis nostræ mandata, ut eamus altera via.

verses.textEn: And, as he ceased speaking these words, a certain Jew approached in the sight of all to sacrifice to the idols upon the altar in the city of Modin, according to the order of the king.
verses.textLa: Et ut cessavit loqui verba hæc, accessit quidam Iudæus in omnium oculis sacrificare idolis super aram in civitate Modin, secundum iussum regis:

verses.textEn: And Mattathias saw, and he grieved, and his temperament trembled, and his fury was enkindled according to the judgment of the law, and leaping up, he slaughtered him on the altar.
verses.textLa: et vidit Mathathias, et doluit, et contremuerunt renes eius, et accensus est furor eius secundum iudicium legis, et insiliens trucidavit eum super aram:

verses.textEn: Moreover, the man whom king Antiochus had sent, who compelled them to immolate, he killed at the same time, and he destroyed the altar,
verses.textLa: sed et virum, quem rex Antiochus miserat, qui cogebat immolare, occidit in ipso tempore, et aram destruxit,

verses.textEn: and he was zealous for the law, just as Phinehas did to Zimri, the son of Salomi.
verses.textLa: et zelatus est legem, sicut fecit Phinees Zamri filio Salomi.

verses.textEn: And Mattathias exclaimed with a loud voice in the city, saying, “All who hold zeal for the law, maintaining the covenant, let them follow me.”
verses.textLa: Et exclamavit Mathathias voce magna in civitate, dicens: Omnis, qui zelum habet legis statuens testamentum, exeat post me.

verses.textEn: And he and his sons fled to the mountains, and they left behind whatever they had in the city.
verses.textLa: Et fugit ipse, et filii eius in montes, et reliquerunt quæcumque habebant in civitate.

verses.textEn: Then many who sought judgment and justice went down into the desert.
verses.textLa: Tunc descenderunt multi quærentes iudicium, et iustitiam, in desertum:

verses.textEn: And they camped there, with their sons, and their wives, and their herds, because evils had overwhelmed them.
verses.textLa: et sederunt ibi ipsi, et filii eorum, et mulieres eorum, et pecora eorum: quoniam inundaverunt super eos mala.

verses.textEn: And it was reported to the king’s men, and to the army that was in Jerusalem, in the city of David, that certain men, who had cast aside the commandment of the king, had departed into the hidden places in the desert, and that many had followed after them.
verses.textLa: Et renunciatum est viris regis, et exercitui, qui erat in Ierusalem civitate David quoniam discessissent viri quidam, qui dissipaverunt mandatum regis in loca occulta in deserto, et abiissent post illos multi.

verses.textEn: And immediately, they went out to them, and they arranged a battle against them, on the day of the Sabbath.
verses.textLa: Et statim perrexerunt ad eos, et constituerunt adversus eos prælium in die Sabbatorum,

verses.textEn: And they said to them: “And now, do you still resist? Go out and act according to the word of king Antiochus, and you will live.”
verses.textLa: et dixerunt ad eos: Resistitis et nunc adhuc? exite, et facite secundum verbum regis Antiochi, et vivetis.

verses.textEn: And they said, “We will not go out, and we will not do the king’s word, so as to profane the day of the Sabbath.”
verses.textLa: Et dixerunt: Non exibimus, neque faciemus verbum regis, ut polluamus diem Sabbatorum.

verses.textEn: And they rushed against them in battle.
verses.textLa: Et concitaverunt adversus eos prælium.

verses.textEn: But they did not respond, nor did they cast a stone at them, nor did they barricade the hidden places,
verses.textLa: Et non responderunt eis, nec lapidem miserunt in eos, nec oppilaverunt loca occulta,

verses.textEn: for they said, “Let us all die in our simplicity. And heaven and earth will testify for us, that you destroyed us unjustly.”
verses.textLa: dicentes: Moriamur omnes in simplicitate nostra: et testes erunt super nos cælum, et terra, quod iniuste perditis nos.

verses.textEn: So they carried out a battle on the Sabbath. And they were put to death, with their wives, and their sons, and their cattle, even to the number of a thousand souls of men.
verses.textLa: Et intulerunt illis bellum Sabbatis: et mortui sunt ipsi, et uxores eorum, et filii eorum, et pecora eorum usque ad mille animas hominum.

verses.textEn: And Mattathias and his friends heard of it, and they held a very great lamentation for them.
verses.textLa: Et cognovit Mathathias, et amici eius, et luctum habuerunt super eos valde.

verses.textEn: And every man said to his neighbor, “If we all do just as our brothers have done, and if we do not fight against the Gentiles for the sake of our lives and our justifications, then they will quickly eradicate us from the earth.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit vir proximo suo: Si omnes fecerimus sicut fratres nostri fecerunt, et non pugnaverimus adversus Gentes pro animabus nostris, et iustificationibus nostris: nunc citius disperdent nos a terra.

verses.textEn: And they decided, on that day, saying: “Every man, who will come against us in warfare on the day of the Sabbath, we will fight against him. And we will not all die, like our brothers who were put to death in the hidden places.”
verses.textLa: Et cogitaverunt in die illa, dicentes: Omnis homo, quicumque venerit ad nos in bello die Sabbatorum, pugnemus adversus eum: et non moriemur omnes, sicut mortui sunt fratres nostri in occultis.

verses.textEn: Then there was assembled before them the synagogue of the Hasideans, strong men from Israel, each one with a will for the law.
verses.textLa: Tunc congregata est ad eos synagoga Assidæorum fortis viribus ex Israel, omnis voluntarius in lege:

verses.textEn: And all those who fled from the evils added themselves to them, and they became a firmament to them.
verses.textLa: et omnes, qui fugiebant a malis, additi sunt ad eos, et facti sunt illis ad firmamentum.

verses.textEn: And they gathered together an army, and they struck down the sinners in their wrath and the wicked men in their indignation. And the others fled to the nations, so as to escape.
verses.textLa: Et collegerunt exercitum, et percusserunt peccatores in ira sua, et viros iniquos in indignatione sua: et ceteri fugerunt ad nationes, ut evaderent.

verses.textEn: And Mattathias and his friends traveled around, and they destroyed the altars.
verses.textLa: Et circuivit Mathathias, et amici eius, et destruxerunt aras:

verses.textEn: And they circumcised all the uncircumcised boys, whom they found within the limits of Israel, and they acted with fortitude.
verses.textLa: et circumciderunt pueros incircumcisos quotquot invenerunt in finibus Israel: et in fortitudine.

verses.textEn: And they pursued the sons of arrogance, and the work was prosperous in their hands.
verses.textLa: Et persecuti sunt filios superbiæ, et prosperatum est opus in manibus eorum:

verses.textEn: And they obtained the law from the hands of the Gentiles, and from the hands of the kings. And they did not surrender the horn to the sinner.
verses.textLa: et obtinuerunt legem de manibus Gentium, et de manibus regum: et non dederant cornu peccatori.

verses.textEn: Then the days drew near when Mattathias would die, and he said to his sons: “Now arrogance and chastisement have been strengthened, and it is a time of overturning and of the wrath of indignation.
verses.textLa: Et appropinquaverunt dies Mathathiæ moriendi, et dixit filiis suis: Nunc confortata est superbia, et castigatio, et tempus eversionis, et ira indignationis:

verses.textEn: Now therefore, O sons, be imitators of the law, and give your lives for the sake of the covenant of your fathers.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo, o filii, æmulatores estote legis, et date animas vestras pro testamento patrum vestrorum,

verses.textEn: And call to mind the works of the fathers, which they have done in their generations. And you will receive great glory and an eternal name.
verses.textLa: et mementote operum patrum, quæ fecerunt in generationibus suis: et accipietis gloriam magnam, et nomen æternum.

verses.textEn: Was not Abraham found to be faithful in temptation, and so it was accounted to him as justice?
verses.textLa: Abraham nonne in tentatione inventus est fidelis, et reputatum est ei ad iustitiam?

verses.textEn: Joseph, in the time of his anguish, kept the commandment, and he was made ruler of Egypt.
verses.textLa: Ioseph in tempore angustiæ suæ custodivit mandatum, et factus est dominus Ægypti.

verses.textEn: Phinehas our father, being zealous in the zeal of God, received the covenant of an eternal priesthood.
verses.textLa: Phinees pater noster, zelando zelum Dei, accepit testamentum sacerdotii æterni.

verses.textEn: Jesus, since he fulfilled the word, was made a commander in Israel.
verses.textLa: Iesus dum implevit verbum, factus est dux in Israel.

verses.textEn: Caleb, since he testified in the assembly, received an inheritance.
verses.textLa: Caleb, dum testificatur in ecclesia, accepit hereditatem.

verses.textEn: David, in his mercy, obtained the throne of a kingdom for all generations.
verses.textLa: David in sua misericordia consecutus est sedem regni in sæcula.

verses.textEn: Elijah, since he was zealous with a zeal for the law, was received into heaven.
verses.textLa: Elias, dum zelat zelum legis, receptus est in cælum.

verses.textEn: Hananiah and Azariah and Mishael, by believing, were delivered from the flame.
verses.textLa: Ananias et Azarias et Misael credentes, liberati sunt de flamma.

verses.textEn: Daniel, in his simplicity, was delivered from the mouth of the lions.
verses.textLa: Daniel in sua simplicitate liberatus est de ore leonum.

verses.textEn: And so, consider that, through generation after generation of all those who trusted in him, none have failed in strength.
verses.textLa: Et ita cogitate per generationem, et generationem: quia omnes qui sperant in eum, non infirmantur.

verses.textEn: And fear not the words of a sinful man, for his glory is dung and worms.
verses.textLa: Et a verbis viri peccatoris ne timueritis: quia gloria eius stercus, et vermis est:

verses.textEn: Today he is extolled, and tomorrow he will not be found, because he has returned into his earth and his thinking has perished.
verses.textLa: hodie extollitur, et cras non invenietur: quia conversus est in terram suam, et cogitatio eius periit.

verses.textEn: Therefore, you sons, be strengthened and act manfully in the law. For by it, you shall become glorious.
verses.textLa: Vos ergo filii confortamini, et viriliter agite in lege: quia in ipsa gloriosi eritis.

verses.textEn: And behold, I know that your brother Simon is a man of counsel. Heed him always, and he will be a father to you.
verses.textLa: Et ecce Simon frater vester, scio quod vir consilii est: ipsum audite semper, et ipse erit vobis pater.

verses.textEn: And Judas Maccabeus, who has been strong and resourceful from his youth, let him be the leader of your militia, and he will manage the war of the people.
verses.textLa: Et Iudas Machabæus fortis viribus a iuventute sua, sit vobis princeps militiæ, et ipse aget bellum populi.

verses.textEn: And you shall add to yourselves all who observe the law, and you shall claim the vindication of your people.
verses.textLa: Et adducetis ad vos omnes factores legis: et vindicate vindictam populi vestri.

verses.textEn: Render to the Gentiles their retribution, and pay attention to the precepts of the law.”
verses.textLa: Retribuite retributionem Gentibus, et intendite in præceptum legis.

verses.textEn: And he blessed them, and he was added to his fathers.
verses.textLa: Et benedixit eos, et appositus est ad patres suos.

verses.textEn: And he passed away in the one hundred and forty-sixth year, and he was buried by his sons in the sepulchers of his fathers, in Modin, and all Israel mourned for him with a great mourning.
verses.textLa: Et defunctus est anno centesimo et quadragesimo sexto: et sepultus est a filiis suis in sepulchris patrum suorum in Modin, et planxerunt eum omnis Israel planctu magno.

verses.textEn: And his son Judas, who was called Maccabeus, rose up in his place.
verses.textLa: Et surrexit Iudas, qui vocabatur Machabæus filius eius pro eo:

verses.textEn: And all his brothers assisted him, along with all those who had joined themselves to his father. And they fought the battle of Israel with rejoicing.
verses.textLa: et adiuvabant eum omnes fratres eius: et universi, qui se coniunxerant patri eius, et præliabantur prælium Israel cum lætitia.

verses.textEn: And he expanded the glory of his people, and he clothed himself with a breastplate like a giant, and he surrounded himself his weapons of war in battles, and he protected the camp with his sword.
verses.textLa: Et dilatavit gloriam populo suo, et induit se loricam sicut gigas, et succinxit se arma bellica sua in præliis, et protegebat castra gladio suo.

verses.textEn: In his actions, he became like a lion, and like a young lion roaring in the hunt.
verses.textLa: Similis factus est leoni in operibus suis, et sicut catulus leonis rugiens in venatione.

verses.textEn: And he pursued the wicked and tracked them down. And those who disturbed his people, he burned with fire.
verses.textLa: Et persecutus est iniquos perscrutans eos: et qui conturbabant populum suum, eos succendit flammis:

verses.textEn: And his enemies were repelled by the fear of him, and all the workers of iniquity were troubled. And salvation was well-directed in his hand.
verses.textLa: et repulsi sunt inimici eius præ timore eius, et omnes operarii iniquitatis conturbati sunt: et directa est salus in manu eius.

verses.textEn: And he provoked many kings, and he gave joy to Jacob by his works, and his memory will be a blessing for all generations.
verses.textLa: Et exacerbabat reges multos, et lætificabat Iacob in operibus suis, et in sæculum memoria eius in benedictione.

verses.textEn: And he traveled through the cities of Judah, and he destroyed the impious out of them, and he turned wrath away from Israel.
verses.textLa: Et perambulavit civitates Iuda, et perdidit impios ex eis, et avertit iram ab Israel.
verses.notes: Judas Maccabeus’ actions during the reign of Antiochus foreshadows the resistance of some Christians, especially in the holy land of Israel, against the followers of the Antichrist. This future resistance may involve some force of arms as well as the peaceful resistance of refusing to follow unjust and sacrilegious laws.

verses.textEn: And he was renowned, even to the utmost part of the earth, and he gathered together those who were perishing.
verses.textLa: Et nominatus est usque ad novissimum terræ, et congregavit pereuntes.

verses.textEn: And so Apollonius gathered together the Gentiles, with a numerous and great army from Samaria, to make war against Israel.
verses.textLa: Et congregavit Apollonius Gentes, et a Samaria virtutem multam et magnam ad bellandum contra Israel.

verses.textEn: And Judas knew about it, and he went forth to meet him. And he struck him and killed him. And many fell down wounded, and the rest fled away.
verses.textLa: Et cognovit Iudas, et exiit obviam illi: et percussit, et occidit illum: et ceciderunt vulnerati multi, et reliqui fugerunt.

verses.textEn: And he took away their spoils. And Judas took possession of the sword of Apollonius, and he fought with it during all his days.
verses.textLa: Et accepit spolia eorum: et gladium Apollonii abstulit Iudas, et erat pugnans in eo omnibus diebus.

verses.textEn: And Seron, the leader of the army of Syria, heard that Judas had gathered together a company of the faithful and an assembly with him.
verses.textLa: Et audivit Seron princeps exercitus Syriæ, quod congregavit Iudas congregationem fidelium, et ecclesiam secum,

verses.textEn: And he said, “I will make a name for myself, and I will be glorified in the kingdom, and I will defeat Judas in warfare, and those who are with him, who have spurned the word of the king.”
verses.textLa: et ait: Faciam mihi nomen, et glorificabor in regno, et debellabo Iudam, et eos, qui cum ipso sunt, qui spernebant verbum regis.

verses.textEn: And he prepared himself. And the camp of the impious went up with him, with strong auxiliaries, so as to act with vengeance upon the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Et præparavit se: et ascenderunt cum eo castra impiorum fortes auxiliarii ut facerent vindictam in filios Israel.

verses.textEn: And they approached even as far as Bethhoron. And Judas went forth to meet him, with a few men.
verses.textLa: Et appropinquaverunt usque ad Bethoron: et exivit Iudas obviam illi cum paucis.

verses.textEn: But when they saw the army coming to meet them, they said to Judas, “How will we few be able to fight against so great and so strong a multitude, even though we are weakened by fasting today?”
verses.textLa: Ut autem viderunt exercitum venientem sibi obviam, dixerunt Iudæ: Quomodo poterimus pauci pugnare contra multitudinem tantam, et tam fortem, et nos fatigati sumus ieiunio hodie?

verses.textEn: And Judas said: “It is easy for many to be enclosed in the hands of a few, for there is no difference in the sight of the God of heaven to liberate by means of many, or by means of few.
verses.textLa: Et ait Iudas: Facile est concludi multos in manus paucorum: et non est differentia in conspectu Dei cæli liberare in multis, et in paucis:

verses.textEn: For victory in warfare is not in the multitude of the army, but in the strength from heaven.
verses.textLa: quoniam non in multitudine exercitus victoria belli, sed de cælo fortitudo est.

verses.textEn: They come to us with a contemptuous multitude and with arrogance, in order to destroy us, with our wives and our sons, and to despoil us.
verses.textLa: Ipsi veniunt ad nos in multitudine contumaci, et superbia ut disperdant nos, et uxores nostras, et filios nostros, et ut spolient nos:

verses.textEn: In truth, we will fight on behalf of our souls and our laws.
verses.textLa: nos vero pugnabimus pro animabus nostris, et legibus nostris:

verses.textEn: And the Lord himself will crush them before our face. But as for you, do not fear them.”
verses.textLa: et ipse Dominus conteret eos ante faciem nostram: vos autem ne timueritis eos.

verses.textEn: And as soon as he had ceased speaking, he attacked them suddenly. And Seron and his army were crushed in his sight.
verses.textLa: Ut cessavit autem loqui, insiluit in eos subito: et contritus est Seron, et exercitus eius in conspectu ipsius:

verses.textEn: And he pursued him from the descent of Bethhoron, even to the plains. And eight hundred of their men were cut down, but the rest fled into the land of the Philistines.
verses.textLa: et persecutus est eum in descensu Bethoron usque in campum, et ceciderunt ex eis octingenti viri, reliqui autem fugerunt in terram Philisthiim.

verses.textEn: And the fear and dread of Judas, as well as his brothers, fell upon all the nations around them.
verses.textLa: Et cecidit timor Iudæ, ac fratrum eius, et formido super omnes gentes in circuitu eorum.

verses.textEn: And his name reached even to the king, and all the nations told stories of the battles of Judas.
verses.textLa: Et pervenit ad regem nomen eius, et de præliis Iudæ narrabant omnes gentes.

verses.textEn: But when king Antiochus heard these accounts, he was angry to his very soul. And he sent and gathered together forces from his entire kingdom, a very strong army.
verses.textLa: Ut audivit autem rex Antiochus sermones istos, iratus est animo: et misit, et congregavit exercitum universi regni sui, castra fortia valde:
verses.notes:
The expression ‘iratus est animo’ means ‘he was angry to the soul,’ in other words, he was very thoroughly angry.
 The Antichrist, about halfway through his reign of nearly seven years, will ready a huge army to bring against the dissension and uprising of the faithful in Israel and the surrounding regions.

verses.textEn: And he opened his treasury, and he gave out stipends to the army for a year. And he commanded them to make ready for all things.
verses.textLa: et aperuit ærarium suum, et dedit stipendia exercitui in annum: et mandavit illis ut essent parati ad omnia.

verses.textEn: And he saw that the money from his treasures had failed, and that the tributes of the country were small, because of the dissension and the scourging that he had caused on earth in order to take away the legitimate laws, which had been since the first days.
verses.textLa: Et vidit quod defecit pecunia de thesauris suis, et tributa regionis modica propter dissensionem, et plagam, quam fecit in terra, ut tolleret legitima, quæ erant a primis diebus:
verses.notes: As he prepares his army, the Antichrist will run low on money, having spent so much on his military in trying to subdue uprisings around the world, enforcing his unjust changes to laws. And he will suffer a lack of tributes (taxes) because his wars and vicious attacks will have devastated the world economy. Also, he will have given out much wealth in gifts and bribes to his supporters.

verses.textEn: And he feared, lest he not have enough the second time as the first, for expenses and gifts, which he had given before with a liberal hand. For his excesses were more than the kings who had been before him.
verses.textLa: et timuit ne non haberet ut semel et bis, in sumptus et donaria, quæ dederat ante larga manu: et abundaverat super reges, qui ante eum fuerant.

verses.textEn: And he was alarmed to his very soul, and he intended to go into Persia, and to take tributes from the regions, and to gather together much money.
verses.textLa: Et consternatus erat animo valde, et cogitavit ire in Persidem, et accipere tributa regionum, et congregare argentum multum.
verses.notes: The reason that the Antichrist will seek money especially from Persia and the surrounding area is that he is from that general region (more specifically, west of Persia, in Assyria). After he begins his reign, he shows particular favor, financially, to that area of the world. So, when taking tributes, he expects more money from them.

verses.textEn: And he left behind Lysias, a nobleman of royal family, to preside over the kingdom from the river Euphrates, even to the river of Egypt,
verses.textLa: Et reliquit Lysiam hominem nobilem de genere regali, super negotia regia, a flumine Euphrate usque ad flumen Ægypti:

verses.textEn: and to raise his son, Antiochus, until he would return.
verses.textLa: et ut nutriret Antiochum filium suum, donec rediret.

verses.textEn: And he handed over to him half of the army, and the elephants. And he commanded him concerning all that he wanted, and concerning the inhabitants of Judea and Jerusalem:
verses.textLa: Et tradidit ei medium exercitum, et elephantos: et mandavit ei de omnibus, quæ volebat, et de inhabitantibus Iudæam, et Ierusalem:

verses.textEn: so that he would send an army against them to crush and to root out the virtue of Israel and the remnant of Jerusalem, and to take away the memory of them from that place,
verses.textLa: et ut mitteret ad eos exercitum ad conterendam, et extirpandam virtutem Israel, et reliquias Ierusalem, et auferendam memoriam eorum de loco:

verses.textEn: and so that he would establish dwelling places for the sons of foreigners in all their parts, and would distribute their land by lot.
verses.textLa: et ut constitueret habitatores filios alienigenas in omnibus finibus eorum, et sorte distribueret terram eorum.

verses.textEn: And so, the king took the remaining part of the army, and he went forth from Antioch, the city of his kingdom, in the one hundred and forty-seventh year. And he crossed over the river Euphrates, and he traveled through the upper regions.
verses.textLa: Et rex assumpsit partem exercitus residui, et exivit ab Antiochia civitate regni sui anno centesimo et quadragesimo septimo: et transfretavit Euphraten flumen, et perambulabat superiores regiones.

verses.textEn: Then Lysias chose Ptolemy, the son of Dorymenes, and Nicanor and Gorgias, powerful men from among the king’s friends.
verses.textLa: Et elegit Lysias Ptolemæum filium Dorymini, et Nicanorem, et Gorgiam, viros potentes ex amicis regis:

verses.textEn: And he sent them with forty thousand men, and seven thousand horsemen, to enter into the land of Judah, and to destroy it, according to the word of the king.
verses.textLa: et misit cum eis quadraginta millia virorum, et septem millia equitum ut venirent in terram Iuda, et disperderent eam secundum verbum regis.

verses.textEn: And so, they proceeded with all their power, and they arrived and took a position near Emmaus, in the land of the plains.
verses.textLa: Et processerunt cum universa virtute sua, et venerunt, et applicuerunt Emmaum in terra campestri.

verses.textEn: And the merchants of the regions heard of their name. And they took very much silver, and gold, and servants, and they came into the camp to take the sons of Israel into servitude. And armies from Syria and from the lands of foreigners were added to them.
verses.textLa: Et audierunt mercatores regionum nomen eorum: et acceperunt argentum, et aurum multum valde, et pueros: et venerunt in castra ut acciperent filios Israel in servos, et additi sunt ad eos exercitus Syriæ, et terræ alienigenarum.

verses.textEn: And Judas and his brothers saw that evils were being multiplied, and that armies had been positioned near their borders. And they knew the words of the king, which ordered the people to be put to death and to be utterly consumed.
verses.textLa: Et vidit Iudas, et fratres eius, quia multiplicata sunt mala, et exercitus applicabant ad fines eorum: et cognoverunt verba regis, quæ mandavit populo facere in interitum, et consummationem:

verses.textEn: And they said, each one to his neighbor, “Let us relieve the dejection of our people, and let us fight on behalf of our people and our sacred places.”
verses.textLa: et dixerunt unusquisque ad proximum suum: Erigamus deiectionem populi nostri, et pugnemus pro populo nostro, et sanctis nostris.
verses.notes: Or, ‘our holy things,’ or ‘our holy places,’ or ‘our sacred places.’

verses.textEn: And an assembly was gathered together, so that they would be prepared for battle, and so that they could pray and ask for mercy and compassion.
verses.textLa: Et congregatus est conventus ut essent parati in prælium: et ut orarent, et peterent misericordiam, et miserationes.

verses.textEn: Now Jerusalem was not inhabited, but was like a desert. There was no one who entered or exited from among her children. And the sanctuary was trampled upon, and the sons of foreigners were in the stronghold. This place was the habitation of the Gentiles. And delight was taken away from Jacob, and the music of flute and harp ceased in that place.
verses.textLa: Et Ierusalem non habitabatur, sed erat sicut desertum: non erat qui ingrederetur et egrederetur de natis eius: et sanctum conculcabatur: et filii alienigenarum erant in arce, ibi erat habitatio Gentium: et ablata est voluptas a Iacob, et defecit ibi tibia, et cithara.

verses.textEn: And they gathered together and came to Mizpah, opposite Jerusalem. For a place of prayer was in Mizpah, in the former Israel.
verses.textLa: Et congregati sunt, et venerunt in Maspha contra Ierusalem: quia locus orationis erat in Maspha ante in Israel.

verses.textEn: And they fasted on that day, and they clothed themselves with haircloth, and they placed ashes on their heads, and they tore their garments.
verses.textLa: Et ieiunaverunt illa die, et induerunt se ciliciis, et cinerem imposuerunt capiti suo: et disciderunt vestimenta sua:

verses.textEn: And they laid open the books of the law, in which the Gentiles searched for the likeness of their idols.
verses.textLa: et expanderunt libros legis, de quibus scrutabantur Gentes similitudinem simulacrorum suorum:

verses.textEn: And they brought the priestly ornaments, and the first fruits and tithes, and they roused the Nazirites, who had fulfilled their days.
verses.textLa: et attulerunt ornamenta sacerdotalia, et primitias, et decimas: et suscitaverunt Nazaræos, qui impleverant dies:
verses.notes: They will call back to service the religious brothers and sisters, who had retired due to old age.

verses.textEn: And they cried out with a loud voice toward heaven, saying: “What shall we do with these, and where shall we take them?
verses.textLa: et clamaverunt voce magna in cælum, dicentes: Quid faciemus istis, et quo eos ducemus?

verses.textEn: For your holy things have been trampled and defiled, and your priests have been in mourning and in humiliation.
verses.textLa: et sancta tua conculcata sunt, et contaminata sunt, et sacerdotes tui facti sunt in luctum, et in humilitatem.

verses.textEn: And behold, the Nations gather together against us, to destroy us. You know what they intend against us.
verses.textLa: Et ecce Nationes convenerunt adversum nos ut nos disperdant: tu scis quæ cogitant in nos.

verses.textEn: How shall we be able to stand before their face, unless you, O God, assist us?”
verses.textLa: Quomodo poterimus subsistere ante faciem eorum, nisi tu Deus adiuves nos?

verses.textEn: Then they sounded the trumpets with a loud call.
verses.textLa: Et tubis exclamaverunt voce magna.

verses.textEn: And after this, Judas appointed commanders over the people: over thousands, and over hundreds, and over fifties, and over tens.
verses.textLa: Et post hæc constituit Iudas duces populi, tribunos, et centuriones, et pentacontarchos, et decuriones.

verses.textEn: And he said to those who were building houses, or who had betrothed wives, who were planting vineyards, or who were terribly afraid, that they should return, each one to his own house, according to the law.
verses.textLa: Et dixit his, qui ædificabant domos, et sponsabant uxores, et plantabant vineas, et formidolosis, ut redirent unusquisque in domum suam secundum legem.

verses.textEn: So they moved the camp, and relocated to the south of Emmaus.
verses.textLa: Et moverunt castra, et collocaverunt ad Austrum Emmaum.

verses.textEn: And Judas said: “Gird yourselves, and be sons of power, and be ready in the morning, so that you may fight against these nations that have assembled against us, so as to destroy us and our sacred things.
verses.textLa: Et ait Iudas: Accingimini, et estote filii potentes, et estote parati in mane, ut pugnetis adversus Nationes has, quæ convenerunt adversus nos disperdere nos, et sancta nostra:

verses.textEn: For it is better for us to die in battle, than to see evils come to our nation and to the sacred places.
verses.textLa: quoniam melius est nos mori in bello, quam videre mala gentis nostræ, et sanctorum.
verses.notes: The sacred things are the Sacraments, which the Antichrist will try to destroy by supporting apostates and severe heretics.

verses.textEn: Nevertheless, as it shall be willed in heaven, so let it be.”
verses.textLa: Sicut autem fuerit voluntas in cælo, sic fiat.

verses.textEn: Then Gorgias took five thousand men and a thousand chosen horsemen, and they moved out of the camp by night,
verses.textLa: Et assumpsit Gorgias quinque millia virorum, et mille equites electos: et moverunt castra nocte

verses.textEn: so that they might set upon the camp of the Jews and strike them suddenly. And the sons who were from the stronghold were their guides.
verses.textLa: ut applicarent ad castra Iudæorum, et percuterent eos subito: et filii, qui erant ex arce, erant illis duces.

verses.textEn: And Judas heard of it, and he rose up, with his powerful men, to strike the force from the king’s army that was in Emmaus.
verses.textLa: Et audivit Iudas, et surrexit ipse et potentes percutere virtutem exercituum regis, qui erant in Emmaum.

verses.textEn: For the army was still dispersed from the camp.
verses.textLa: Adhuc enim dispersus erat exercitus a castris.

verses.textEn: And Gorgias came by night, into the camp of Judas, and found no one, and he sought them in the mountains. For he said, “These men flee from us.”
verses.textLa: Et venit Gorgias in castra Iudæ noctu, et neminem invenit, et quærebat eos in montibus: quoniam dixit: Fugiunt hi a nobis.

verses.textEn: And when it had become day, Judas appeared in the plain with only three thousand men, who had neither armor nor swords.
verses.textLa: Et cum dies factus esset, apparuit Iudas in campo cum tribus millibus virorum tantum: qui tegumenta, et gladios non habebant:

verses.textEn: And they saw the strength of the camp of the Gentiles, and the men in armor, and the horsemen surrounding them, and that these were trained to fight.
verses.textLa: et viderunt castra Gentium valida, et loricatos, et equitatus in circuitu eorum, et hi docti ad prælium.

verses.textEn: And Judas said to the men who were with him: “Do not be afraid of their multitude, and do not dread their attack.
verses.textLa: Et ait Iudas viris, qui secum erant: Ne timueritis multitudinem eorum, et impetum eorum ne formidetis.

verses.textEn: Remember in what way salvation came to our fathers in the Red Sea, when Pharaoh pursued them with a great army.
verses.textLa: Mementote qualiter salvi facti sunt patres nostri in Mari Rubro, cum sequeretur eos Pharao cum exercitu multo.

verses.textEn: And now, let us cry out to heaven, and the Lord will have mercy on us, and he will remember the covenant of our fathers, and he will crush this army before our face this day.
verses.textLa: Et nunc clamemus in cælum: et miserebitur nostri Dominus, et memor erit testamenti patrum nostrorum, et conteret exercitum istum ante faciem nostram hodie:

verses.textEn: And all nations shall know that there is One who redeems and frees Israel.”
verses.textLa: et scient omnes gentes quia est qui redimat, et liberet Israel.

verses.textEn: And the foreigners lifted up their eyes, and they saw them coming against them.
verses.textLa: Et elevaverunt alienigenæ oculos suos, et viderunt eos venientes ex adverso.

verses.textEn: And they went out of the camp into battle, and those who were with Judas sounded the trumpet.
verses.textLa: Et exierunt de castris in prælium, et tuba cecinerunt hi, qui erant cum Iuda:

verses.textEn: And they came together. And the Gentiles were crushed, and they fled into the plains.
verses.textLa: Et congressi sunt: et contritæ sunt Gentes, et fugerunt in campum.

verses.textEn: But the last of them all fell by the sword, and they pursued them even to Gazara, and even to the plains of Idumea, and Azotus, and Jamnia. And there fell from them as many as three thousand men.
verses.textLa: Novissimi autem omnes ceciderunt in gladio, et persecuti sunt eos usque Gezeron, et usque in campos Idumææ, et Azoti, et Iamniæ: et ceciderunt ex illis usque ad tria millia virorum.

verses.textEn: And Judas returned, with his army following him.
verses.textLa: Et reversus est Iudas, et exercitus eius, sequens eum.

verses.textEn: And he said to the people: “Do not desire the spoils; for there is war before us.
verses.textLa: Dixitque ad populum: Non concupiscatis spolia: quia bellum contra nos est,

verses.textEn: And Gorgias and his army are near us on the mountain. But stand firm now against our enemies, and fight against them, and you shall take the spoils afterwards, securely.”
verses.textLa: et Gorgias et exercitus eius prope nos in monte: sed state nunc contra inimicos nostros, et expugnate eos, et sumetis postea spolia securi.

verses.textEn: And while Judas was speaking these words, behold, a certain part of them appeared, looking out from the mountain.
verses.textLa: Et adhuc loquente Iuda hæc, ecce apparuit pars quædam prospiciens de monte.

verses.textEn: And Gorgias saw that his men were put to flight, and that they had set fire to the camp. For the smoke that he saw declared what had happened.
verses.textLa: Et vidit Gorgias quod in fugam conversi sunt sui, et succenderunt castra: fumus enim, qui videbatur, declarabat quod factum est.

verses.textEn: When they had seen this, they became very afraid, seeing at the same time both Judas and his army in the plains prepared to do battle.
verses.textLa: Quibus illi conspectis timuerunt valde, aspicientes simul et Iudam, et exercitum in campo paratum ad prælium.

verses.textEn: So they all fled away into the encampment of the foreigners.
verses.textLa: Et fugerunt omnes in campum alienigenarum:

verses.textEn: And Judas returned to take the spoils of the camp, and they obtained much gold and silver, and hyacinth, and purple of the sea, and great riches.
verses.textLa: et Iudas reversus est ad spolia castrorum, et acceperunt aurum multum, et argentum, et hyacinthinum, et purpuram marinam, et opes magnas.
verses.notes: The ‘marinam purpuram’ is a purple dye, or cloths colored with such a dye, made from shellfish and often called Tyrian purple or Royal purple. By today’s standards, this color is actually more of a scarlet hue. The reference to ‘hyacinthinum’ is probably silk or other cloths colored with this blue dye.

verses.textEn: And returning, they sang a canticle, and they blessed God in heaven, because he is good, because his mercy is with every generation.
verses.textLa: Et conversi, hymnum canebant, et benedicebant Deum in cælum, quoniam bonus est, quoniam in sæculum misericordia eius.

verses.textEn: And so, a great salvation occurred in Israel in that day.
verses.textLa: Et facta est salus magna in Israel in die illa.

verses.textEn: But those among the foreigners who escaped went and reported to Lysias all that had happened.
verses.textLa: Quicumque autem alienigenarum evaserunt, venerunt, et nunciaverunt Lysiæ universa, quæ acciderant.

verses.textEn: And when he heard these things, he was discouraged, being alarmed to his very soul. For things had not occurred in Israel according to his wishes, nor as the king had commanded.
verses.textLa: Quibus ille auditis consternatus animo deficiebat: quod non qualia voluit, talia contigerunt in Israel, et qualia mandavit rex.

verses.textEn: And, in the following year, Lysias gathered together sixty thousand chosen men and five thousand horsemen, so that he might defeat them in warfare.
verses.textLa: Et sequenti anno congregavit Lysias virorum electorum sexaginta millia, et equitum quinque millia, ut debellaret eos.

verses.textEn: And they came into Judea, and they positioned their camp in Bethzur, and Judas met them with ten thousand men.
verses.textLa: Et venerunt in Iudæam, et castra posuerunt in Bethoron, et occurrit illis Iudas cum decem millibus viris.

verses.textEn: And they saw the strength of the army, and so he prayed, and he said: “Blessed are you, Savior of Israel, who crushed the assault of the powerful by the hand of your servant David, and who delivered up the camp of the foreigners into the hand of Jonathan, the son of Saul, and his armor bearer.
verses.textLa: Et viderunt exercitum fortem, et oravit, et dixit: Benedictus es salvator Israel, qui contrivisti impetum potentis in manu servi tui David, et tradidisti castra alienigenarum in manu Ionathæ filii Saul, et armigeri eius.

verses.textEn: Enclose this army in the hand of your people Israel, and let them be confounded in their soldiers and their horsemen.
verses.textLa: Conclude exercitum istum in manu populi tui Israel, et confundantur in exercitu suo, et equitibus.

verses.textEn: Strike them with dread, and melt away the boldness of their strength, and let them shudder in their grief.
verses.textLa: Da illis formidinem, et tabefac audaciam virtutis eorum, et commoveantur contritione sua.

verses.textEn: Cast them down with the sword of those who love you, and let all who know your name praise you with hymns.”
verses.textLa: Deiice illos gladio diligentium te: et collaudent te omnes, qui noverunt nomen tuum in hymnis.

verses.textEn: And they went forth to battle, and there fell from the army of Lysias five thousand men.
verses.textLa: Et commiserunt prælium: et ceciderunt de exercitu Lysiæ quinque millia virorum.

verses.textEn: But Lysias, seeing their flight and the boldness of the Jews, and that they were prepared either to live or to die with fortitude, went to Antioch and chose soldiers, so that they might come back to Judea with greater numbers.
verses.textLa: Videns autem Lysias fugam suorum, et Iudæorum audaciam, et quod parati sunt aut vivere, aut mori fortiter, abiit Antiochiam, et elegit milites, ut multiplicati rursus venirent in Iudæam.

verses.textEn: Then Judas and his brothers said: “Behold, our enemies have been crushed. Let us go up now to cleanse and renew the holy places.”
verses.textLa: Dixit autem Iudas, et fratres eius: Ecce contriti sunt inimici nostri: ascendamus nunc mundare sancta, et renovare.

verses.textEn: And all the army gathered together, and they ascended to Mount Zion.
verses.textLa: Et congregatus est omnis exercitus, et ascenderunt in montem Sion.

verses.textEn: And they saw the sanctuary deserted, and the altar profaned, and the gates burned, and weeds growing up in the courts, as in a forest or as on the mountains, and the adjoining chambers demolished.
verses.textLa: Et viderunt sanctificationem desertam, et altare profanatum, et portas exustas, et in atriis virgulta nata sicut in saltu, vel in montibus, et pastophoria diruta.

verses.textEn: And they rent their garments, and they made a great wailing, and they placed ashes on their heads.
verses.textLa: Et sciderunt vestimenta sua, et planxerunt planctu magno, et imposuerunt cinerem super caput suum.

verses.textEn: And they fell to the ground on their faces, and they sounded the trumpets of alarm, and they cried out toward heaven.
verses.textLa: Et ceciderunt in faciem super terram, et exclamaverunt tubis signorum, et clamaverunt in cælum.

verses.textEn: Then Judas numbered men to fight against those who were in the stronghold, until they had cleansed the holy places.
verses.textLa: Tunc ordinavit Iudas viros ut pugnarent adversus eos, qui erant in arce, donec emundarent sancta.

verses.textEn: And he chose priests without blemish, whose will held to the law of God.
verses.textLa: Et elegit sacerdotes sine macula, voluntatem habentes in lege Dei:

verses.textEn: And they cleansed the holy places, and they took away the stones of defilement to an unclean place.
verses.textLa: et mundaverunt sancta, et tulerunt lapides contaminationis in locum immundum.

verses.textEn: And he considered the altar of holocausts, which had been profaned, as to what he should do with it.
verses.textLa: Et cogitavit de altari holocaustorum, quod profanatum erat, quid de eo faceret.

verses.textEn: And a good counsel fell upon them, to destroy it, lest it might become a reproach to them, because the Gentiles had defiled it; so they demolished it.
verses.textLa: Et incidit illis consilium bonum ut destruerent illud: ne forte illis esset in opprobrium, quia contaminaverunt illud Gentes, et demoliti sunt illud.

verses.textEn: And they stored the stones in the mountain house, in a fitting place, until there should come a prophet, who would provide an answer about these.
verses.textLa: Et reposuerunt lapides in monte domus in loco apto, quoadusque veniret propheta, et responderet de eis.

verses.textEn: Then they took whole stones, according to the law, and they built a new altar, according to that which was before.
verses.textLa: Et acceperunt lapides integros secundum legem, et ædificaverunt altare novum secundum illud, quod fuit prius:

verses.textEn: And they rebuilt the holy places and the things that were in the inner parts of the temple, and they sanctified the temple and the courts.
verses.textLa: et ædificaverunt sancta, et quæ intra domum erant intrinsecus: et ædem, et atria sanctificaverunt.

verses.textEn: And they made new holy vessels, and they brought the lampstand, and the altar of incense, and the table into the temple.
verses.textLa: Et fecerunt vasa sancta nova, et intulerunt candelabrum, et altare incensorum, et mensam in templum.

verses.textEn: And they placed incense on the altar, and they lit the lamps, which were on the lampstand, and they gave light in the temple.
verses.textLa: Et incensum posuerunt super altare, et accenderunt lucernas quæ super candelabrum erant, et lucebant in templo.

verses.textEn: And they placed the bread on the table, and they hung up the veils, and they completed all the works which they had begun.
verses.textLa: Et posuerunt super mensam panes, et appenderunt vela, et consummaverunt omnia opera, quæ fecerant.

verses.textEn: And they arose before the morning, on the twenty-fifth day of the ninth month, (which is the month of Kislev) in the one hundred and forty-eighth year.
verses.textLa: Et ante matutinum surrexerunt quinta et vigesima die mensis noni (hic est mensis Casleu) centesimi quadragesimi octavi anni:
verses.notes: The Jewish month of Kislev falls in November/ December in the Christian calendar. In the future, the Church will celebrate Christmas, beginning on November 25th, for eight days. November 25th is the true date of the Birth of Christ.

verses.textEn: And they offered sacrifice, according to the law, on the new altar of holocausts that they made.
verses.textLa: et obtulerunt sacrificium secundum legem super altare holocaustorum novum, quod fecerunt.

verses.textEn: According to the time and according to the day, on which the Gentiles had contaminated it, on the same day, it was renewed with canticles, and lutes, and lyres, and cymbals.
verses.textLa: Secundum tempus et secundum diem, in qua contaminaverunt illud gentes, in ipsa renovatum est in canticis, et citharis, et cinyris, et in cymbalis.

verses.textEn: And all the people fell upon their faces, and they adored, and they blessed, toward heaven, him that had prospered them.
verses.textLa: Et cecidit omnis populus in faciem, et adoraverunt, et benedixerunt in cælum eum, qui prosperavit eis.

verses.textEn: And they kept the dedication of the altar for eight days, and they offered holocausts with joy, and sacrifices of salvation and praise.
verses.textLa: Et fecerunt dedicationem altaris diebus octo, et obtulerunt holocausta cum lætitia, et sacrificium salutaris et laudis.

verses.textEn: And they adorned the face of the temple with crowns of gold and small shields. And they dedicated the gates and the adjoining chambers, and they set up doors on them.
verses.textLa: Et ornaverunt faciem templi coronis aureis, et scutulis: et dedicaverunt portas, et pastophoria, et imposuerunt eis ianuas.

verses.textEn: And there was very great rejoicing among the people, and the disgrace of the Gentiles was averted.
verses.textLa: Et facta est lætitia in populo magna valde, et aversum est opprobrium Gentium.

verses.textEn: And Judas, and his brothers, and all the assembly of Israel decreed that the day of the dedication of the altar must be kept in its time, from year to year, for eight days, from the twenty-fifth day of the month of Kislev, with joy and gladness.
verses.textLa: Et statuit Iudas, et fratres eius, et universa ecclesia Israel ut agatur dies dedicationis altaris in temporibus suis ab anno in annum per dies octo a quinta et vigesima die mensis Casleu, cum lætitia et gaudio.

verses.textEn: And they built up, at that time, Mount Zion, with high walls and strong towers all around, lest the Gentiles should at any time come and trample upon it, as they did before.
verses.textLa: Et ædificaverunt in tempore illo montem Sion, et per circuitum muros altos, et turres firmas, nequando venirent Gentes, et conculcarent eum sicut antea fecerunt.

verses.textEn: And he stationed a garrison there, to keep it, and he fortified it, in order to guard Bethzur, so that the people might have a fortification opposite the face of Idumea.
verses.textLa: Et collocavit illic exercitum, ut servarent eum, et munivit eum ad custodiendum Bethsuram, ut haberet populus munitionem contra faciem Idumææ.

verses.textEn: And it happened that, when the surrounding nations heard that the altar and the sanctuary had been rebuilt as before, they were very angry.
verses.textLa: Et factum est, ut audierunt Gentes in circuitu quia ædificatum est altare, et sanctuarium sicut prius, iratæ sunt valde:

verses.textEn: And they intended to destroy the people of Jacob that were among them, and they began to kill some of the people, and to persecute them.
verses.textLa: et cogitabant tollere genus Iacob, qui erant inter eos, et cœperunt occidere de populo, et persequi.

verses.textEn: Then Judas defeated in warfare the sons of Esau in Idumea, and those who were in Akrabattene, because they besieged the Israelites, and he struck them with a great scourging.
verses.textLa: Et debellabat Iudas filios Esau in Idumæa, et eos, qui erant in Acrabathane: quia circumsedebant Israelitas, et percussit eos plaga magna.

verses.textEn: And he remembered the malice of the sons of Baean, who were a snare and a scandal to the people, lying in ambush for them in the way.
verses.textLa: Et recordatus est malitiam filiorum Bean, qui erant populo in laqueum et in scandalum, insidiantes ei in via.

verses.textEn: And they were trapped by him in the towers, and he took up a position near them, and he anathematized them, and he burned their towers with fire, along with all who were in them.
verses.textLa: Et conclusi sunt ab eo in turribus, et applicuit ad eos, et anathematizavit eos, et incendit turres eorum igni cum omnibus, qui in eis erant.

verses.textEn: Then he crossed over to the sons of Ammon, and he found a strong hand, and an abundant people, and Timothy was their commander.
verses.textLa: Et transivit ad filios Ammon, et invenit manum fortem, et populum copiosum, et Timotheum ducem ipsorum:

verses.textEn: And he engaged in many battles with them, and they were crushed in their sight, and he struck them down.
verses.textLa: et commisit cum eis prælia multa, et contriti sunt in conspectu eorum, et percussit eos:

verses.textEn: And he seized the city of Jazer, and her sister cities, and he returned to Judea.
verses.textLa: et cepit Gazer civitatem, et filias eius, et reversus est in Iudæam.
verses.notes: The word ‘filias’ means ‘daughters,’ but here it is used to refer to the smaller cities and towns around Jazer.

verses.textEn: And the Gentiles, who were in Gilead, gathered together against the Israelites, who were within their borders, to take them away, and so they fled into the fortress of Dathema.
verses.textLa: Et congregatæ sunt gentes, quæ sunt in Galaad adversus Israelitas, qui erant in finibus eorum ut tollerent eos: et fugerunt in Datheman munitionem,

verses.textEn: And they sent letters to Judas and his brothers, saying: “The Gentiles all around have been gathering together against us to carry us away.
verses.textLa: et miserunt litteras ad Iudam, et fratres eius, dicentes: Congregatæ sunt adversum nos gentes per circuitum, ut nos auferant:

verses.textEn: And they are preparing to come and occupy the fortress into which we have fled. And Timothy is the commander of their army.
verses.textLa: et parant venire, et occupare munitionem, in quam confugimus: et Timotheus est dux exercitus eorum.

verses.textEn: Now, therefore, come and rescue us from their hands, for many of us have fallen.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo veni, et eripe nos de manibus eorum, quia cecidit multitudo de nobis.

verses.textEn: And all our brothers, who were in the places of Tob, have been put to death. And they have led away as captives their wives, and their children, and their spoils. And they have slain nearly a thousand men in that place.”
verses.textLa: Et omnes fratres nostri, qui erant in locis Tubin, interfecti sunt: et captivas duxerunt uxores eorum, et natos, et spolia, et peremerunt illic fere mille viros.

verses.textEn: And while they were still reading these letters, behold, there arrived from Galilee other messengers, with torn garments, who announced according to these words:
verses.textLa: Et adhuc epistolæ legebantur, et ecce alii nuncii venerunt de Galilæa conscissis tunicis, nunciantes secundum verba hæc:

verses.textEn: saying that those of Ptolemais and Tyre and Sidon have assembled against them, “and all of Galilee has been filled with foreigners, in order to consume us.”
verses.textLa: dicentes: Convenisse adversum se a Ptolemaida, et Tyro, et Sidone: et repleta est omnis Galilæa alienigenis, ut nos consumant.

verses.textEn: So then, when Judas and the people heard these words, a great assembly came together, to consider what they should do for their brothers who were in trouble and were being assailed by them.
verses.textLa: Ut audivit autem Iudas, et populus, sermones istos, convenit ecclesia magna cogitare quid facerent fratribus suis, qui in tribulatione erant, et expugnabantur ab eis.

verses.textEn: And Judas said to Simon his brother: “Choose men for yourself, and go, and free your brothers in Galilee. But I and my brother Jonathan, will go into the country of Gilead.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Iudas Simoni fratri suo: Elige tibi viros, et vade, et libera fratres tuos in Galilæa: ego autem, et frater meus Ionathas ibimus in Galaaditim.

verses.textEn: And he left behind Joseph, son of Zachariah, and Azariah, as commanders of the people, with the remainder of the army, in Judea, to guard it.
verses.textLa: Et reliquit Iosephum filium Zachariæ, et Azariam duces populi cum residuo exercitu in Iudæa ad custodiam:

verses.textEn: And he instructed them, saying, “Take charge of this people, but do not go to war against the Gentiles, until we return.”
verses.textLa: et præcepit illis, dicens: Præestote populo huic: et nolite bellum committere adversum gentes, donec revertamur.

verses.textEn: Now three thousand men were divided to Simon, to go into Galilee, but eight thousand were divided to Judas, to go into the land of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Et partiti sunt Simoni viri tria millia, ut iret in Galilæam: Iudæ autem octo millia in Galaaditim.
