verses.textEn: And those who were in the city ascended upon the wall, with their wives and children, having torn their tunics. And they cried out with a loud voice, asking Simon to grant them a pledge.
verses.textLa: Et ascenderunt qui erant in civitate cum uxoribus, et filiis supra murum scissis tunicis suis, et clamaverunt voce magna, postulantes a Simone dextras sibi dari,

verses.textEn: And they said, “Do not repay us according to our malice, but according to your mercy.”
verses.textLa: et dixerunt: Non nobis reddas secundum malitias nostras, sed secundum misericordias tuas.

verses.textEn: And weeping, Simon did not destroy them. Yet he cast them out of the city, and he cleansed the buildings, in which there had been idols. And then he entered into it with hymns, blessing the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et flexus Simon non debellavit eos: eiecit tamen eos de civitate, et mundavit ædes, in quibus fuerant simulacra, et tunc intravit in eam cum hymnis benedicens Dominum:

verses.textEn: And, having cast out of it all uncleanness, he placed in it men who would observe the law. And he fortified it and made it his dwelling place.
verses.textLa: et eiecta ab ea omni immunditia, collocavit in ea viros, qui legem facerent: et munivit eam, et fecit sibi habitationem.

verses.textEn: But those who were in the stronghold of Jerusalem were prohibited from going out and entering the region, and from buying and selling. And they were very hungry, and many of them perished through famine.
verses.textLa: Qui autem erant in arce Ierusalem, prohibebantur egredi et ingredi regionem, et emere, ac vendere: et esurierunt valde, et multi ex eis fame perierunt,

verses.textEn: And they cried out to Simon, that they might receive a pledge, and he granted it to them. And he cast them out of there, and he cleansed the stronghold from contaminations.
verses.textLa: et clamaverunt ad Simonem ut dextras acciperent: et dedit illis: et eiecit eos inde, et mundavit arcem a contaminationibus:

verses.textEn: And they entered into it on the twenty-third day of the second month, in the one hundred and seventy-first year, with thanksgiving, and palm branches, and lyres, and cymbals, and psalteries, and hymns, and canticles, because a great enemy had been crushed out of Israel.
verses.textLa: et intraverunt in eam tertia et vigesima die secundi mensis, anno centesimo septuagesimo primo cum laude, et ramis palmarum, et cinyris, et cymbalis, et nablis, et hymnis, et canticis, quia contritus est inimicus magnus ex Israel.

verses.textEn: And he established that these days should be kept every year with rejoicing.
verses.textLa: Et constituit ut omnibus annis agerentur dies hi cum lætitia.

verses.textEn: And he fortified the mountain of the temple, which was near the stronghold, and he lived there himself, along with those who were with him.
verses.textLa: Et munivit montem templi, qui erat secus arcem, et habitavit ibi ipse, et qui cum eo erant.

verses.textEn: And Simon saw that John, his son, was a valiant man in battle. And so he appointed him as commander of all the forces. And he lived in Gazara.
verses.textLa: Et vidit Simon Ioannem filium suum, quod fortis prælii vir esset: et posuit eum ducem virtutum universarum: et habitavit in Gazaris.

verses.textEn: In the one hundred and seventy-second year, king Demetrius gathered together his army, and he went into Media to obtain auxiliaries to fight against Trypho.
verses.textLa: Anno centesimo septuagesimo secundo congregavit rex Demetrius exercitum suum, et abiit in Mediam ad contrahenda sibi auxilia, ut expugnaret Tryphonem.

verses.textEn: And Arsaces, the king of Persia and Media, heard that Demetrius entered his confines, and so he sent one of his princes to capture him alive and to bring him to him.
verses.textLa: Et audivit Arsaces rex Persidis, et Mediæ, quia intravit Demetrius confines suos, et misit unum de principibus suis ut comprehenderet eum vivum, et adduceret eum ad se.

verses.textEn: And he went out and struck the camp of Demetrius. And captured him and brought him to Arsaces, and he placed him under guard.
verses.textLa: Et abiit, et percussit castra Demetrii: et comprehendit eum, et duxit eum ad Arsacem, et posuit eum in custodiam.

verses.textEn: And the entire land of Judah was quiet during all the days of Simon, and he sought what was good for his people. And his power and his glory pleased them through all his days.
verses.textLa: Et siluit omnis terra Iuda omnibus diebus Simonis, et quæsivit bona genti suæ: et placuit illis potestas eius, et gloria eius omnibus diebus.

verses.textEn: And, with all his glory, he accepted Joppa as a port, and he made it an entrance to the islands of the sea.
verses.textLa: Et cum omni gloria sua accepit Ioppen in portum, et fecit introitum in insulis maris.

verses.textEn: And he enlarged the boundaries of his nation, and he controlled the countryside.
verses.textLa: Et dilatavit fines gentis suæ, et obtinuit regionem.

verses.textEn: And he gathered together many captives, and he was the ruler of Gazara and Bethzur, and the stronghold. And he took uncleanness away from it, and there was no one who could withstand him.
verses.textLa: Et congregavit captivitatem multam, et dominatus est Gazaræ, et Bethsuræ, et arci: et abstulit immunditias ex ea, et non erat qui resisteret ei.

verses.textEn: And each one cultivated his land in peace, and the land of Judah produced its fruits, and the trees of the fields their fruit.
verses.textLa: Et unusquisque colebat terram suam cum pace: et terra Iuda dabat fructus suos, et ligna camporum fructum suum.

verses.textEn: All the elders sat in the streets, and they discussed what was good for the country, and the youths clothed themselves in glory and in the robes of war.
verses.textLa: Seniores in plateis sedebant omnes, et de bonis terræ tractabant, et iuvenes induebant se gloriam, et stolas belli.

verses.textEn: And he gave tributes of provisions to the cities, and he decreed that they would have equipment for fortification, so that the fame of his glory was renowned, even to the ends of the earth.
verses.textLa: Et civitatibus tribuebat alimonias, et constituebat eas ut essent vasa munitionis quoadusque nominatum est nomen gloriæ eius usque ad extremum terræ.

verses.textEn: He caused there to be peace over the land, and Israel was rejoicing with great joy.
verses.textLa: Fecit pacem super terram, et lætatus est Israel lætitia magna.

verses.textEn: And each one sat under his vine and under his fig tree. And there was no one who would terrify them.
verses.textLa: Et sedit unusquisque sub vite sua, et sub ficulnea sua: et non erat qui eos terreret.

verses.textEn: There was nothing left of those who might fight against them in the land; kings had been crushed in those days.
verses.textLa: Defecit impugnans eos super terram: reges contriti sunt in diebus illis.

verses.textEn: And he confirmed all the humble of his people, and he sought the law, and he took away every iniquity and evil.
verses.textLa: Et confirmavit omnes humiles populi sui, et legem exquisivit, et abstulit omnem iniquum et malum:

verses.textEn: He glorified the sanctuary, and he multiplied the vessels of the holy places.
verses.textLa: sancta glorificavit, et multiplicavit vasa sanctorum.

verses.textEn: And it was heard at Rome, and even in Sparta, that Jonathan had passed away. And they were very sorrowful.
verses.textLa: Et auditum est Romæ quia defunctus esset Ionathas: et usque in Spartiatas: et contristati sunt valde.

verses.textEn: But when they heard that Simon, his brother, had been made high priest in his place, and that he obtained the entire country and the cities in it,
verses.textLa: Ut audierunt autem quod Simon frater eius factus esset summus sacerdos loco eius, et ipse obtineret omnem regionem, et civitates in ea;

verses.textEn: they wrote to him on tablets of brass, so as to renew the friendship and alliance, which they had made with Judas and with Jonathan, his brothers.
verses.textLa: scripserunt ad eum in tabulis æreis, ut renovarent amicitias, et societatem quam fecerant cum Iuda, et cum Ionatha fratribus eius.

verses.textEn: And they were read in the sight of the assembly at Jerusalem. And this is a copy of the letters that the Spartans sent:
verses.textLa: Et lectæ sunt in conspectu ecclesiæ in Ierusalem. Et hoc exemplum epistolarum, quas Spartiatæ miserunt:

verses.textEn: “The leaders and the cities of the Spartans, to Simon, the great priest, and to the elders, and the priests, and the rest of the people of the Jews, their brothers: greetings.
verses.textLa: SPARTIANORUM principes, et civitates, Simoni sacerdoti magno, et senioribus, et sacerdotibus, et reliquo populo Iudæorum, fratribus, salutem.

verses.textEn: The ambassadors who were sent to our people have reported to us of your glory, and honor, and rejoicing. And we were glad at their arrival.
verses.textLa: Legati, qui missi sunt ad populum nostrum, nunciaverunt nobis de vestra gloria, et honore, ac lætitia: et gavisi sumus in introitu eorum.

verses.textEn: And we wrote down what was said by them in the councils of the people, as follows: ‘Numenius, the son of Antiochus, and Antipater, the son of Jason, ambassadors of the Jews, came to us to renew the former friendship with us.
verses.textLa: Et scripsimus quæ ab eis erant dicta in conciliis populi, sic: Numenius Antiochi, et Antipater Iasonis filius, legati Iudæorum, venerunt ad nos, renovantes nobiscum amicitiam pristinam.

verses.textEn: And it pleased the people to receive the men gloriously, and to place a copy of their words in a section of the public books, so as to be a memorial for the people of the Spartans. Furthermore, we have written a copy of them to Simon, the great priest.’ ”
verses.textLa: Et placuit populo excipere viros gloriose, et ponere exemplum sermonum eorum in segregatis populi libris, ut sit ad memoriam populo Spartiatarum. Exemplum autem horum scripsimus Simoni magno sacerdoti.

verses.textEn: But after this, Simon sent Numenius to Rome, in possession of a great shield of gold, weighing over a thousand pounds, to confirm the association with them.
verses.textLa: Post hæc autem misit Simon Numenium Romam, habentem clypeum aureum magnum, pondo mnarum mille, ad statuendam cum eis societatem.
verses.notes: One mina is 1/60th of a talent or about 1.1 pounds. One thousand minas is about 1,100 pounds.

verses.textEn: But when the people of Rome had heard these words, they said: “With what deeds of thanksgiving shall we repay Simon and his sons?
verses.textLa: Cum autem audisset populus Romanus sermones istos, dixerunt: Quam gratiarum actionem reddemus Simoni, et filiis eius?

verses.textEn: For he has vindicated his brothers, and he has fought off the enemies of Israel from them.” And so, they decreed him free, and they registered it on tablets of brass and placed it in an inscription on mount Zion.
verses.textLa: Restituit enim ipse fratres suos, et expugnavit inimicos Israel ab eis, et statuerunt ei libertatem, et descripserunt in tabulis æreis, et posuerunt in titulis in monte Sion.

verses.textEn: And this is a copy of the writing: “On the eighteenth day of the month Elul, in the one hundred and seventy-second year, the third year under Simon, the great priest at Asaramel,
verses.textLa: Et hoc est exemplum scripturæ: OCTAVA decima die mensis Elul, anno centesimo septuagesimo secundo, anno tertio sub Simone sacerdote magno in Asaramel,

verses.textEn: in a great convocation of the priests, and the people, and the leaders of the nation, and the elders of the country, these things were noted: ‘Now there have often been battles in our country.
verses.textLa: in conventu magno sacerdotum, et populi, et principum gentis, et seniorum regionis, nota facta sunt hæc: Quoniam frequenter facta sunt prælia in regione nostra.

verses.textEn: And Simon, the son of Mattathias, of the sons of Jarib, and his brothers, have put themselves in danger, and have withstood the enemies of their nation, so as to establish their holy places and the law. And they have glorified their people with great glory.
verses.textLa: Simon autem Mathathiæ filius ex filiis Iarib, et fratres eius dederunt se periculo, et restiterunt adversariis gentis suæ, ut starent sancta ipsorum, et lex: et gloria magna glorificaverunt gentem suam.

verses.textEn: And Jonathan gathered together his nation, and he was made their great priest, and he was laid to rest among his people.
verses.textLa: Et congregavit Ionathas gentem suam, et factus est illis sacerdos magnus, et appositus est ad populum suum.

verses.textEn: And their enemies wanted to trample and lay waste to their country, and to extend their hands against their holy places.
verses.textLa: Et voluerunt inimici eorum calcare, et atterere regionem ipsorum, et extendere manus in sancta eorum.

verses.textEn: Then Simon resisted, and he fought for his nation, and he requested much money, and he armed the valiant men of his nation and gave them wages.
verses.textLa: Tunc restitit Simon, et pugnavit pro gente sua, et erogavit pecunias multas, et armavit viros virtutis gentis suæ, et dedit illis stipendia:

verses.textEn: And he fortified the cities of Judea and Bethzur, which are along the borders of Judea, where the weaponry of the enemies was before. And he placed a garrison of Jewish men there.
verses.textLa: et munivit civitates Iudææ, et Bethsuram, quæ erat in finibus Iudææ, ubi erant arma hostium antea: et posuit illic præsidium viros Iudæos.

verses.textEn: And he fortified Joppa, which is by the sea, and Gazara, which is on the border of Azotus, where the enemies stayed before, and he placed Jews there. And he positioned with them whatever was fitting for their preparations.
verses.textLa: Et Ioppen munivit, quæ erat ad mare: et Gazaram, quæ est in finibus Azoti, in qua hostes antea habitabant, et collocavit illic Iudæos: et quæcumque apta erant ad correptionem eorum, posuit in eis.

verses.textEn: And the people saw the acts of Simon, and the glory that he intended to bring to his nation, and they made him their commander and first priest, because he had done all these things, and because of the justice and faith that he maintained for his nation, and because he sought to exalt his people by all means.
verses.textLa: Et vidit populus actum Simonis, et gloriam, quam cogitabat facere genti suæ, et posuerunt eum ducem suum, et principem sacerdotum, eo quod ipse fecerat hæc omnia, et iustitiam, et fidem, quam conservavit genti suæ, et exquisivit omni modo exaltare populum suum.

verses.textEn: And in his days, there was prosperity by his hands, so that the Gentiles were taken away from their country, and also those who were in the city of David, in Jerusalem, in the stronghold, from which they went out and contaminated all the places that were around the sanctuary, and from which they brought a great scourging against chastity.
verses.textLa: Et in diebus eius prosperatum est in manibus eius, ut tollerentur Gentes de regione ipsorum, et qui in civitate David erant in Ierusalem in arce, de qua procedebant, et contaminabant omnia, quæ in circuitu sanctorum sunt, et inferebant plagam magnam castitati:

verses.textEn: And he placed in it Jewish men, as a means of protection for the region and the city, and he raised the walls of Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: et collocavit in ea viros Iudæos ad tutamentum regionis, et civitatis, et exaltavit muros Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: And king Demetrius confirmed him in the high priesthood.
verses.textLa: Et rex Demetrius statuit illi summum sacerdotium.

verses.textEn: According to these things, he made him his friend, and he glorified him with great glory.
verses.textLa: Secundum hæc fecit eum amicum suum, et glorificavit eum gloria magna.

verses.textEn: For he heard that the Romans had called the Jews their friends, and associates, and brothers, and that they received the ambassadors of Simon with glory,
verses.textLa: Audivit enim quod appellati sunt Iudæi a Romanis amici, et socii, et fratres, et quia susceperunt legatos Simonis gloriose:

verses.textEn: and that the Jews and their priests had consented that he should be their governor and high priest unceasingly, until there should arise a faithful prophet,
verses.textLa: et quia Iudæi, et sacerdotes eorum consenserunt eum esse ducem suum, et summum sacerdotem in æternum, donec surgat propheta fidelis:
verses.notes: Here is a good example of the effect of context on translation. The phrase ‘in æternum’ would usually be translated as ‘in eternity,’ or ‘forever.’ But in light of the subsequent clause, ‘until a faithful prophet shall arise,’ the phrase ‘in æternum’ should be translated somewhat more conditionally, as in ‘unceasingly’ or ‘continually.’

verses.textEn: and that he should be the commander over them, and that he should take care of the sanctuary, and that he should appoint foremen over their works, and over the country, and over the weapons, and over the strongholds,
verses.textLa: et ut sit super eos dux, et ut cura esset illi pro sanctis, et ut constitueret præpositos super opera eorum, et super regionem, et super arma, et super præsidia:

verses.textEn: and that he should take care of the holy places, and that he should be obeyed by all, and that all the records in the country should be recorded in his name, and that he should be clothed in purple and gold,
verses.textLa: et cura sit illi de sanctis: et ut audiatur ab omnibus, et scribantur in nomine eius omnes conscriptiones in regione: et ut operiatur purpura, et auro:

verses.textEn: and that it should not be lawful for any of the people or the priests to make void any of these things, nor to contradict things that are said by him, nor to call together an assembly in the country without him, nor to be clothed in purple, nor to use a clasp of gold.
verses.textLa: et ne liceat ulli ex populo, et ex sacerdotibus irritum facere aliquid horum, et contradicere his, quæ ab eo dicuntur, aut convocare conventum in regione sine ipso: et vestiri purpura, et uti fibula aurea.

verses.textEn: And whoever will do otherwise, or who will make void any of these things, shall be guilty.
verses.textLa: Qui autem fecerit extra hæc, aut irritum fecerit aliquid horum, reus erit.

verses.textEn: And it pleased all the people to appoint Simon, and to act according to these words.
verses.textLa: Et complacuit omni populo statuere Simonem, et facere secundum verba ista.

verses.textEn: And Simon accepted it, and he was pleased to perform the office of the high priesthood, and to be the commander and leader of the people of the Jews, and of the priests, and to be foremost over them all.
verses.textLa: Et suscepit Simon, et placuit ei ut summo sacerdotio fungeretur, et esset dux, et princeps gentis Iudæorum, et sacerdotum, et præesset omnibus.

verses.textEn: And they asked that this writing be placed on tablets of brass, and be placed within the precinct of the sanctuary in a celebrated place,
verses.textLa: Et scripturam istam dixerunt ponere in tabulis æreis, et ponere eas in peribolo sanctorum, in loco celebri:

verses.textEn: and that a copy of these be placed in the treasury, so that Simon and his sons may have it.’ “
verses.textLa: exemplum autem eorum ponere in ærario, ut habeat Simon, et filii eius.

verses.textEn: And king Antiochus, the son of Demetrius, sent letters from the islands of the sea to Simon, the priest and leader of the nation of the Jews, and to all the people.
verses.textLa: Et misit rex Antiochus filius Demetrii epistolas ab insulis maris Simoni sacerdoti, et principi gentis Iudæorum, et universæ genti:

verses.textEn: And these continued in this way: “King Antiochus to Simon, the great priest, and to the people of the Jews: greetings.
verses.textLa: et erant continentes hunc modum: REX Antiochus Simoni sacerdoti magno, et genti Iudæorum salutem.

verses.textEn: Since certain pestilent persons have obtained the kingdom of our fathers, it is my will, then, to vindicate the kingdom and to restore it, just as it was before. And so, I have chosen a great army, and I have built ships of war.
verses.textLa: Quoniam quidem pestilentes obtinuerunt regnum patrum nostrorum, volo autem vendicare regnum, et restituere illud sicut erat antea: et electam feci multitudinem exercitus, et feci naves bellicas.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, I intend to pass through the region, so that I may take revenge on those who have corrupted our country and who have desolated many cities in my kingdom.
verses.textLa: Volo autem procedere per regionem ut ulciscar in eos, qui corruperunt regionem nostram, et qui desolaverunt civitates multas in regno meo.

verses.textEn: Now, therefore, I confirm to you all the oblations that all the kings before me have remitted to you, and whatever other gifts they remitted to you.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo statuo tibi omnes oblationes, quas remiserunt tibi ante me omnes reges, et quæcumque alia dona remiserunt tibi:

verses.textEn: And I permit you to make a striking of your own coins for your country.
verses.textLa: et permitto tibi facere percussuram proprii numismatis in regione tua:

verses.textEn: Moreover, let Jerusalem be holy and free. And all the weapons that have been made, and the fortresses that you have constructed, or that you hold, let them remain with you.
verses.textLa: Ierusalem autem sanctam esse, et liberam: et omnia arma, quæ fabricata sunt, et præsidia, quæ construxisti, quæ tenes, maneant tibi.

verses.textEn: And all that is owed to the king, and what should belong to the king in the future, from this time and for all time, is remitted to you.
verses.textLa: Et omne debitum regis: et quæ futura sunt regi, ex hoc, et in totum tempus remittuntur tibi.

verses.textEn: Yet, when we have obtained our kingdom, we will glorify you, and your nation, and the temple with great glory, so much so that your glory shall be made manifest in all the earth.”
verses.textLa: Cum autem obtinuerimus regnum nostrum, glorificabimus te, et gentem tuam, et templum gloria magna ita ut manifestetur gloria vestra in universa terra.

verses.textEn: In the one hundred and seventy-fourth year, Antiochus went into the land of his fathers, and all the armies came over to him, so that few were left with Trypho.
verses.textLa: Anno centesimo septuagesimo quarto exiit Antiochus in terram patrum suorum, et convenerunt ad eum omnes exercitus, ita ut pauci relicti essent cum Tryphone.

verses.textEn: And king Antiochus followed him as he fled along the sea coast and came to Dora.
verses.textLa: Et insecutus est eum Antiochus rex, et venit Doram fugiens per maritimam.

verses.textEn: For he knew that evils had gathered together upon him, and that his troops had forsaken him.
verses.textLa: Sciebat enim quod congregata sunt mala in eum, et reliquit eum exercitus.

verses.textEn: And Antiochus took up a position above Dora, with one hundred and twenty thousand men of warfare and eight thousand horsemen.
verses.textLa: Et applicuit Antiochus super Doram cum centum viginti millibus virorum belligeratorum, et octo millibus equitum:

verses.textEn: And he encircled the city, and the ships drew near by sea. And they assailed the city by land and by sea, and they permitted no one to go in or out.
verses.textLa: et circuivit civitatem, et naves a mari accesserunt: et vexabant civitatem a terra, et mari, et neminem sinebant ingredi, vel egredi.

verses.textEn: But Numenius, and those who had been with him, came from the city of Rome, having letters written to the kings and the regions, in which was contained these things:
verses.textLa: Venit autem Numenius, et qui cum eo fuerant, ab urbe Roma, habentes epistolas regibus, et regionibus scriptas, in quibus continebantur hæc:

verses.textEn: “Lucius, consul of the Romans, to king Ptolemy: greetings.
verses.textLa: LUCIUS consul Romanorum, Ptolemæo regi salutem.

verses.textEn: The ambassadors of the Jews, our friends, came to us, to renew the former friendship and alliance, having been sent from Simon, the leader of the priests and the people of the Jews.
verses.textLa: Legati Iudæorum venerunt ad nos amici nostri, renovantes pristinam amicitiam, et societatem, missi a Simone principe sacerdotum, et populo Iudæorum.

verses.textEn: And they also brought a shield of gold of over a thousand pounds.
verses.textLa: Attulerunt autem et clypeum aureum mnarum mille.

verses.textEn: And so, it was pleasing to us to write to the kings and the regions, that they should do no harm to them, nor fight against them, and their cities, and their regions, and that they should bear no assistance to those fighting against them.
verses.textLa: Placuit itaque nobis scribere regibus, et regionibus, ut non inferant illis mala, neque impugnent eos, et civitates eorum, et regiones eorum: et ut non ferant auxilium pugnantibus adversus eos.

verses.textEn: And it seemed good to us to receive the shield from them.
verses.textLa: Visum autem est nobis accipere ab eis clypeum.

verses.textEn: If, therefore, those who are pestilent have taken refuge with you from their region, hand them over to Simon, the leader of the priests, so that he may give a verdict to them according to their law.”
verses.textLa: Si qui ergo pestilentes refugerunt de regione ipsorum ad vos, tradite eos Simoni principi sacerdotum, ut vindicet in eos secundum legem suam.

verses.textEn: These same things were written to king Demetrius, and to Attalus, and to Ariarathes, and to Arsaces,
verses.textLa: Hæc eadem scripta sunt Demetrio regi, et Attalo, et Ariarathi, et Arsaci,

verses.textEn: and to all the regions, and to Lampsacus and to the Spartans, and to Delos, and Myndos, and Sicyon, and Caria, and Samos, and Pamphylia, and Lycia, and Halicarnassus, and Cos, and Side, and Aradus, and Rhodes, and Phaselis, and Gortyna, and Gnidus, and Cyprus, and Cyrene.
verses.textLa: et in omnes regiones: et Lampsaco, et Spartiatis, et in Delum, et in Myndum, et in Sicyonem, et in Cariam, et in Samum, et in Pamphyliam, et in Lyciam, et in Alicarnassum, et in Coo, et in Siden, et in Aradon, et in Rhodum, et in Phaselidem, et in Gortynam, et Gnidum, et Cyprum, et Cyrenen.

verses.textEn: Moreover, they wrote a copy of these things to Simon, the leader of the priests and the people of the Jews.
verses.textLa: Exemplum autem eorum scripserunt Simoni principi sacerdotum, et populo Iudæorum.

verses.textEn: But king Antiochus positioned his camp near Dora a second time, moving his hand against it continually, and making machines of war. And he enclosed Trypho, lest he escape.
verses.textLa: Antiochus autem rex applicuit castra in Doram secundo, admovens ei semper manus, et machinas faciens: et conclusit Tryphonem, ne procederet.

verses.textEn: And Simon sent two thousand chosen men to him as auxiliaries, and silver, and gold, and an abundance of equipment.
verses.textLa: Et misit ad eum Simon duo millia virorum electorum in auxilium, et argentum, et aurum, et vasa copiosa:

verses.textEn: And he was not willing to receive them, but he broke all of the pact that he made with him before, and he alienated himself from him.
verses.textLa: et noluit ea accipere, sed rupit omnia, quæ pactus est cum eo antea, et alienavit se ab eo.

verses.textEn: And he sent to him Athenobius, one of his friends, to deal with him, saying: “You hold Joppa and Gazara, and the stronghold that is in Jerusalem, which are cities of my kingdom.
verses.textLa: Et misit ad eum Athenobium unum de amicis suis, ut tractaret cum ipso, dicens: Vos tenetis Ioppen, et Gazaram, et arcem, quæ est in Ierusalem, civitates regni mei:

verses.textEn: You have desolated their parts, and you have caused a great scourging in the land, and you have become ruler throughout many places in my kingdom.
verses.textLa: fines earum desolastis, et fecistis plagam magnam in terra, et dominati estis per loca multa in regno meo.

verses.textEn: Now, therefore, hand over the cities that you occupy, and the tributes of the places where you have become ruler beyond the borders of Judea.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo tradite civitates, quas occupastis, et tributa locorum, in quibus dominati estis extra fines Iudææ.

verses.textEn: But if not, give me for them five hundred talents of silver, and for the destruction that you have caused, and for the tributes of the cities, another five hundred talents. But if not, we will come and fight against you.”
verses.textLa: Sin autem, date pro illis quingenta talenta argenti, et exterminii, quod exterminastis, et tributorum civitatum alia talenta quingenta: sin autem, veniemus, et expugnabimus vos.
verses.notes: Five thousand talents is over 33,000 pounds. The amount requested is an exorbitant sum that the king probably did not expect would be able to be paid.

verses.textEn: So Athenobius, the friend of the king, came to Jerusalem and saw the glory of Simon, and his splendor in gold and silver, and his abundance of equipment, and he was astonished. And he repeated the words of the king to him.
verses.textLa: Et venit Athenobius amicus regis in Ierusalem, et vidit gloriam Simonis, et claritatem in auro, et argento, et apparatum copiosum: et obstupuit: et retulit ei verba regis.

verses.textEn: And Simon responded to him, and he said to him: “We have not taken foreign land, nor do we hold anything foreign, but we hold the inheritance of our fathers, which was for some time unjustly possessed by our enemies.
verses.textLa: Et respondit ei Simon, et dixit ei: Neque alienam terram sumpsimus, neque aliena detinemus: sed hereditatem patrum nostrorum, quæ iniuste ab inimicis nostris aliquo tempore possessa est.

verses.textEn: In truth, since we have the opportunity, we claim the inheritance of our fathers.
verses.textLa: Nos vero tempus habentes, vindicamus hereditatem patrum nostrorum.

verses.textEn: And as to Joppa and Gazara, which you demand, they brought a great scourging on the people and our country. For these, we will give one hundred talents.” And Athenobius did not respond a word to him.
verses.textLa: Nam de Ioppe, et Gazara quæ expostulas, ipsi faciebant in populo plagam magnam, et in regione nostra: horum damus talenta centum. Et non respondit ei Athenobius verbum.

verses.textEn: But, returning with anger to the king, he reported to him these words, and the glory of Simon, and all that he had seen. And the king became angry with a great anger.
verses.textLa: Reversus autem cum ira ad regem, renunciavit ei verba ista, et gloriam Simonis, et universa, quæ vidit, et iratus est rex ira magna.

verses.textEn: But Trypho fled by ship to Orthosia.
verses.textLa: Tryphon autem fugit navi in Orthosiada.

verses.textEn: And the king appointed Cendebeus as commander of the seacoast, and he gave him an army of foot soldiers and horsemen.
verses.textLa: Et constituit rex Cendebæum ducem maritimum, et exercitum peditum et equitum dedit illi.

verses.textEn: And he commanded him to move with his camp against the face of Judea. And he commanded him to build up Kedron, and to barricade the gates of the city, and to make war against the people. But the king pursued Trypho.
verses.textLa: Et mandavit illi movere castra contra faciem Iudææ: et mandavit ei ædificare Gedorem, et obstruere portas civitatis, et debellare populum. Rex autem persequebatur Typhonem.

verses.textEn: And Cendebeus passed through to Jamnia, and he began to provoke the populace, and to trample Judea, and to take the people captive, and to execute, and to build up Kedron.
verses.textLa: Et pervenit Cendebæus Iamniam, et cœpit irritare plebem, et conculcare Iudæam, et captivare populum, et interficere, et ædificare Gedorem.

verses.textEn: And he stationed horsemen and an army there, so that they could go out and travel through the ways of Judea, as the king appointed him to do.
verses.textLa: Et collocavit illic equites, et exercitum: ut egressi perambularent viam Iudææ, sicut constituit ei rex.

verses.textEn: And so, John came up from Gazara, and he reported to Simon, his father, what Cendebeus had done against their people.
verses.textLa: Et ascendit Ioannes de Gazaris, et nunciavit Simoni patri suo quæ fecit Cendebæus in populo ipsorum.

verses.textEn: And Simon called his two eldest sons, Judas and John, and he said to them: “I and my brothers, and my father’s house, have fought against the enemies of Israel from our youth, even to this day. And this work has prospered in our hands, so that we have delivered Israel several times.
verses.textLa: Et vocavit Simon duos filios seniores, Iudam, et Ioannem, et ait illis: Ego, et fratres mei, et domus patris mei expugnavimus hostes Israel ab adolescentia usque in hunc diem: et prosperatum est in manibus nostris liberare Israel aliquoties.

verses.textEn: And now that I am old, you must act in place of me and my brothers, and go out to fight for our nation. Truly, may the help of heaven be with you.”
verses.textLa: Nunc autem senui, sed estote loco meo, et fratres mei, et egressi pugnate pro gente nostra: auxilium vero de cælo vobiscum sit.

verses.textEn: Then he chose from the region twenty thousand men of warfare, and horsemen; and they started out toward Cendebeus. And they rested in Modin.
verses.textLa: Et elegit de regione viginti millia virorum belligeratorum, et equites; et profecti sunt ad Cendebæum: et dormierunt in Modin.

verses.textEn: And they rose up in the morning and went out into the plains. And behold, an abundant army of foot soldiers and horsemen was there to meet them, and there was a river flowing between them.
verses.textLa: Et surrexerunt mane, et abierunt in campum: et ecce exercitus copiosus in obviam illis peditum, et equitum, et fluvius torrens erat inter medium ipsorum.

verses.textEn: And he and his people moved their camp opposite their face, and he saw the trepidation of the people to cross over the river, and so he crossed over first. And seeing him, the men also crossed after him.
verses.textLa: Et admovit castra contra faciem eorum ipse, et populus eius, et vidit populum trepidantem ad transfretandum torrentem, et transfretavit primus: et viderunt eum viri, et transierunt post eum.

verses.textEn: And he divided the people and the horsemen into the midst of the foot soldiers. But the horsemen of the adversary were exceedingly numerous.
verses.textLa: Et divisit populum et equites in medio peditum: erat autem equitatus adversariorum copiosus nimis.
verses.notes: They positioned the horses surrounded by foot soldiers, so that, when they sounded the trumpets, only the enemy horses would panic and flee. The enemy army had too many horses.

verses.textEn: And they sounded the holy trumpets. And Cendebeus and his army were turned back. And many of them fell wounded. But the rest fled into the fortress.
verses.textLa: Et exclamaverunt sacris tubis, et in fugam conversus est Cendebæus, et castra eius: et ceciderunt ex eis multi vulnerati: residui autem in munitionem fugerunt.

verses.textEn: Then Judas, the brother of John, was wounded. But John pursued them, until he came to Kedron, which he had built.
verses.textLa: Tunc vulneratus est Iudas frater Ioannis: Ioannes autem insecutus est eos, donec venit Cedronem, quam ædificavit:

verses.textEn: And they fled all the way to the towers that were in the fields of Azotus, and he burnt them with fire. And there fell of them two thousand men, and he returned to Judea in peace.
verses.textLa: et fugerunt usque ad turres, quæ erant in agris Azoti, et succendit eas igni. Et ceciderunt ex illis duo millia virorum, et reversus est in Iudæam in pace.

verses.textEn: Now Ptolemy, the son of Abubus, was appointed commander over the plain of Jericho, and he held much silver and gold.
verses.textLa: Et Ptolemæus filius Abobi constitutus erat dux in campo Iericho, et habebat argentum, et aurum multum.

verses.textEn: For he was the son-in-law of the high priest.
verses.textLa: Erat enim gener summi sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: And his heart was exalted, and he wanted to obtain the region, and he devised treachery against Simon and his sons, so as to destroy them.
verses.textLa: Et exaltatum est cor eius, et volebat obtinere regionem, et cogitabat dolum adversus Simonem, et filios eius, ut tolleret eos.

verses.textEn: Now when Simon was traveling through the cities that were in the region of Judea, and acting with concern for them, he went down to Jericho, he and Mattathias and Judas, his sons, in the one hundred and seventy-seventh year, in the eleventh month; this is the month of Shevat.
verses.textLa: Simon autem, perambulans civitates, quæ erant in regione Iudææ, et solicitudinem gerens earum, descendit in Iericho ipse, et Mathathias filius eius, et Iudas, anno centesimo septuagesimo septimo, mense undecimo: hic est mensis Sabath.
verses.notes: The month of Shevat is the eleventh month of the sacred calendar, wherein Nisan is the first month.

verses.textEn: And the son of Abubus received them, with deceitfulness, into a little fortress, which is called Dok, that he had built. And he made them a great feast, and he hid men there.
verses.textLa: Et suscepit eos filius Abobi in munitiunculam, quæ vocatur Doch, cum dolo, quam ædificavit: et fecit eis convivium magnum, et abscondit illic viros.

verses.textEn: And when Simon and his sons became inebriated, Ptolemy and his men rose up, and took their weapons, and entered into the gathering. And they killed him, and his two sons, and some of his servants.
verses.textLa: Et cum inebriatus esset Simon, et filii eius, surrexit Ptolemæus cum suis, et sumpserunt arma sua, et intraverunt in convivium, et occiderunt eum, et duos filios eius, et quosdam pueros eius.

verses.textEn: And he committed a great treachery in Israel, and he repaid good with evil.
verses.textLa: Et fecit deceptionem magnam in Israel, et reddidit mala pro bonis.

verses.textEn: And Ptolemy wrote about these things, and he sent to the king, so that he would send him an army to assist him, and he could deliver to him the region, and their cities and tributes.
verses.textLa: Et scripsit hæc Ptolemæus, et misit regi ut mitteret ei exercitum in auxilium, et traderet ei regionem, et civitates eorum, et tributa.

verses.textEn: And he sent others to Gazara to destroy John. And he sent letters to the tribunes to come to him, and he would give them silver, and gold, and gifts.
verses.textLa: Et misit alios in Gazaram tollere Ioannem: et tribunis misit epistolas, ut venirent ad se, et daret eis argentum, et aurum, et dona.

verses.textEn: And he sent others to occupy Jerusalem and the mountain of the temple.
verses.textLa: Et alios misit occupare Ierusalem, et montem templi.

verses.textEn: Now a certain one, running ahead, reported to John in Gazara, that his father and his brothers perished, and that “he sent to kill you also.”
verses.textLa: Et præcurrens quidam, nunciavit Ioanni in Gazara, quia periit pater eius, et fratres eius, et quia misit te quoque interfici.

verses.textEn: But when he heard it, he was very afraid, and he apprehended the men who came to destroy him, and he killed them. For he knew that they sought to destroy him.
verses.textLa: Ut audivit autem, vehementer expavit: et comprehendit viros, qui venerant perdere eum, et occidit eos: cognovit enim quia quærebant eum perdere.

verses.textEn: And the rest of the stories about John, and his wars, and the virtuous deeds that he performed with fortitude, and the building of the walls that he raised, and the things that he did,
verses.textLa: Et cetera sermonum Ioannis, et bellorum eius, et bonarum virtutum, quibus fortiter gessit, et ædificii murorum, quos extruxit, et rerum gestarum eius:

verses.textEn: behold, these have been written in the book of the days of his priesthood, from the time that he became high priest, after his father.
verses.textLa: ecce hæc scripta sunt in libro dierum sacerdotii eius, ex quo factus est princeps sacerdotum post patrem suum.
